Little by little, however, they tend to try out forms of rebellious action. In working towards liberation, one must neither lose sig ht of this passivity nor overlook the moment of awakening.

被压迫者在他们不真实的世界观和自我观中，感觉自己是压迫者拥有的“物品”。对于后者来说，存在就是拥有，几乎总是以牺牲那些拥有者为代价什么也没有。对于被压迫者来说，在他们生存体验的某个时刻，存在并不意味着要像压迫者，而是要受压迫者支配，依赖压迫者。因此，被压迫者在情感上是依赖的。

Within their unauthentic view of the world and of themselves, the oppressed feel like “things” owned by the oppressor. For the ­latter, to be is to have, almost always at the expense of those who have ­nothing. For the oppressed, at a certain point in their existential experience, to be is not to resemble the oppressor, but to be under him, to depend on him. Accordingly, the oppressed are emotionally dependent.

农民是一个依赖者。他不能说出自己想要什么。在发现自己的依赖性之前，他很痛苦。他在家里发泄情绪，对孩子大喊大叫，打他们，感到绝望。他抱怨妻子，认为一切都很糟糕。他不向老板发泄情绪，因为他认为老板是高人一等的人。很多时候，农民通过喝酒来发泄他的悲伤。23

The peasant is a dependent. He can’t say what he wants. Before he discovers his dependence, he suffers. He lets off steam at home, where he shouts at his children, beats them, and despairs. He complains about his wife and thinks everything is dreadful. He doesn’t let off steam with the boss because he thinks the boss is a superior being. Lots of times, the peasant gives vent to his ­sorrows by drinking.23

这种完全的情感依赖会导致被压迫者产生弗洛姆所说的恋尸行为：毁灭生命——他们自己的或被压迫的同胞的生命。

This total emotional dependence can lead the oppressed to what Fromm calls necrophilic behavior: the destruction of life—their own or that of their oppressed fellows.

只有当被压迫者发现压迫者并参与有组织的解放斗争时，他们才会开始相信自己。这种发现不能纯粹是智力上的，而必须涉及行动；也不能局限于单纯的行动主义，而必须包括认真的反思：只有这样，它才会成为一种实践。

It is only when the oppressed find the oppressor out and become involved in the organized struggle for their liberation that they begin to believe in themselves. This discovery cannot be purely intellec­-tual but must involve action; nor can it be limited to mere activism, but must include serious reflection: only then will it be a praxis.

无论被压迫者在解放斗争的哪个阶段，都必须与他们进行批判性和解放性的对话，这种对话以行动为前提。24对话 的内容可以而且应该根据历史条件和被压迫者对现实的认识水平而变化。但是，用独白、口号和公报代替对话，就是试图用驯化手段解放被压迫者。试图解放被压迫者而不让他们反思性地参与解放行动，就是把他们当作必须从火中救出来的物体；就是把他们引入民粹主义的陷阱，把他们变成可以操纵的群众。

Critical and liberating dialogue, which presupposes action, must be carried on with the oppressed at whatever the stage of their ­struggle for liberation.24 The content of that dialogue can and should vary in accordance with historical conditions and the level at which the oppressed perceive reality. But to substitute monologue, slo-gans, and communiqués for dialogue is to attempt to liberate the oppressed with the instruments of domestication. Attempting to ­liberate the oppressed without their reflective participation in the act of liberation is to treat them as objects which must be saved from a burning building; it is to lead them into the populist pitfall and transform them into masses which can be manipulated.

在解放的各个阶段，被压迫者必须看到——男性和女性的自我都致力于成为更加完整的人这一本体论和历史使命。当人们不再错误地试图将人类的内容与其历史形式一分为二时，反思和行动就变得势在必行。

At all stages of their liberation, the oppressed must see them­-selves as women and men engaged in the ontological and ­historical vocation of becoming more fully human. Reflection and action be-come imperative when one does not erroneously attempt to dichotomize the content of humanity from its historical forms.

坚持让被压迫者反思他们的具体处境，并不是号召他们进行空谈革命。相反，反思——真正的反思——会导致行动。另一方面，当情况需要采取行动时，只有当行动的后果成为批判性反思的对象时，这种行动才会构成真正的实践。从这个意义上说，实践是被压迫者新的存在理由；而开启这一存在理由的历史时刻的革命，如果没有他们伴随的自觉参与，就无法实现。否则，行动就是纯粹的激进主义。

The insistence that the oppressed engage in reflection on their concrete situation is not a call to armchair revolution. On the contrary, reflection—true reflection—leads to action. On the other hand, when the situation calls for action, that action will constitute an authentic praxis only if its consequences become the object of critical reflection. In this sense, the praxis is the new raison d’être of the oppressed; and the revolution, which inaugurates the historical moment of this raison d’être, is not viable apart from their concomitant conscious involvement. Otherwise, action is pure activism.

然而，要实现这一实践，就必须信任被压迫者及其推理能力。缺乏这种信任的人将无法发起（或放弃）对话、反思和交流，并会陷入使用口号、公报、独白和指令的境地。对解放事业的肤浅转变会带来这种危险。

To achieve this praxis, however, it is necessary to trust in the oppressed and in their ability to reason. Whoever lacks this trust will fail to initiate (or will abandon) dialogue, reflection, and commu­nication, and will fall into using slogans, communiqués, monologues, and instructions. Superficial conversions to the cause of liberation carry this danger.

被压迫者一方的政治行动必须是真正意义上的教育行动，因此，是与被压迫者一起的行动。那些为解放而工作的人绝不能利用被压迫者的情感依赖——这种依赖是他们周围具体的统治环境的产物，这种环境导致了他们对世界的错误看法。利用他们的依赖来制造更大的依赖是压迫者的策略。

Political action on the side of the oppressed must be ­pedagogical action in the authentic sense of the word, and, therefore, action with the oppressed. Those who work for liberation must not take advantage of the emotional dependence of the oppressed—­dependence that is the fruit of the concrete situation of ­domination which surrounds them and which engendered their unauthentic view of the world. Using their dependence to create still greater dependence is an oppressor tactic.

自由主义行动必须认识到这种依赖性是一个弱点，必须通过反思和行动将其转化为独立性。然而，即使是最善意的领导人也不能把独立性作为礼物赐予他人。被压迫者的解放是女性和男性的解放，而不是事物的解放。因此，虽然没有人能仅凭自己的努力解放自己，但他也不会被他人解放。解放是一种人类现象，不能由半人实现。任何试图将人视为半人的行为都是错误的。人只会使人失去人性。当人们因遭受压迫而已经失去人性时，他们的解放过程绝不能采用非人性化的方法。

Libertarian action must recognize this dependence as a weak point and must attempt through reflection and action to ­transform it into independence. However, not even the best-intentioned leadership can bestow independence as a gift. The liberation of the oppressed is a liberation of women and men, not things. ­Accordingly, while no one liberates himself by his own efforts alone, neither is he liberated by others. Liberation, a human phenomenon, cannot be achieved by semihumans. Any attempt to treat people as semihumans only dehumanizes them. When people are already dehumanized, due to the oppression they suffer, the process of their liberation must not employ the methods of dehumanization.

因此，革命领导层在解放工作中应采用的正确方法不是“自由主义宣传”。领导层也不能仅仅向被压迫者“灌输”自由信仰，以此赢得他们的信任。正确的方法在于对话。被压迫者必须为解放而战的信念不是革命领导层的恩赐，而是他们自身良知的结果。

The correct method for a revolutionary leadership to employ in the task of liberation is, therefore, not “libertarian propaganda.” Nor can the leadership merely “implant” in the oppressed a belief in ­freedom, thus thinking to win their trust. The correct method lies in dialogue. The conviction of the oppressed that they must fight for their liberation is not a gift bestowed by the revolutionary leadership, but the result of their own conscientização.

革命领袖必须认识到，他们自己对斗争必要性的信念（革命智慧不可或缺的一部分）不是别人给他们的——如果它是真实的。这种信念不能被包装和出售；相反，它是通过全面的反思和行动而获得的。只有领导者自己在历史环境中对现实的参与，才使他们批评这种状况并希望改变它。

The revolutionary leaders must realize that their own ­conviction of the necessity for struggle (an indispensable dimension of revolu-­tionary wisdom) was not given to them by anyone else—if it is ­authentic. This conviction cannot be packaged and sold; it is reached, rather, by means of a totality of reflection and action. Only the leaders’ own involvement in reality, within an historical ­situation, led them to criticize this situation and to wish to change it.

同样，被压迫者（他们只有在被说服时才会投身斗争，如果他们不做出这样的承诺，他们就会拒绝提供这场斗争的必要条件）必须作为主体而不是客体达到这一信念。他们还必须批判性地干预他们周围和他们所打上烙印的局势；宣传无法做到这一点。虽然对斗争必要性的信念（没有它，斗争就不可能进行）对于革命领导来说是不可或缺的（事实上，正是这种信念构成了领导），但对被压迫者来说，这也是必要的。除非有人打算为被压迫者而不是与他们一起进行转变，否则它是必要的。我相信只有后一种转变形式才是有效的。25

Likewise, the oppressed (who do not commit themselves to the struggle unless they are convinced, and who, if they do not make such a commitment, withhold the indispensable conditions for this struggle) must reach this conviction as Subjects, not as objects. They also must intervene critically in the situation which surrounds them and whose mark they bear; propaganda cannot achieve this. While the conviction of the necessity for struggle (without which the struggle is unfeasible) is indispensable to the revolutionary leadership (indeed, it was this conviction which constituted that leadership), it is also necessary for the oppressed. It is necessary, that is, unless one intends to carry out the transformation for the oppressed rather than with them. It is my belief that only the latter form of transformation is valid.25

提出这些考虑的目的是为了捍卫革命的显著教育性质。每个时代的革命领袖都肯定被压迫者必须接受解放斗争的人们——这是显而易见的一点——也因此隐含地承认了这场斗争的教育方面。然而，这些领导人中的许多人（也许是由于对教育的自然和可以理解的偏见）最终使用了压迫者所采用的“教育”方法。他们否认解放过程中的教育作用，但他们使用宣传来说服。

The object in presenting these considerations is to defend the ­eminentl y pedagogical character of the revolution. The ­revolutionary leaders of every epoch who have affirmed that the oppressed must accept the struggle for their liberation—an obvious point—have also thereby implicitly recognized the pedagogical aspect of this strug-gle. Many of these leaders, however (perhaps due to natural and understandable biases against pedagogy), have ended up using the “educational” methods employed by the oppressor. They deny pedagogical action in the liberation process, but they use propaganda to convince.

被压迫者必须认识到，当他们接受为人道化而斗争时，他们也从那一刻起接受了对这场斗争的全部责任。他们必须意识到，他们不仅是为了免于饥饿而斗争，而且是为了

It is essential for the oppressed to realize that when they accept the struggle for humanization they also accept, from that moment, their total responsibility for the struggle. They must realize that they are fighting not merely for freedom from hunger, but for

……创造和建设的自由，好奇和冒险的自由。这种自由要求个人积极主动、负责任，而不是奴隶或机器上一个吃饱喝足的齿轮。……人类不是奴隶是不够的；如果社会条件进一步促进机器人的存在，结果将不是对生命的热爱，而是对死亡的热爱。26

. . . freedom to create and to construct, to wonder and to ven­-ture. Such freedom requires that the individual be active and responsible, not a slave or a well-fed cog in the machine. . . . It is not enough that men are not slaves; if social conditions ­further the existence of automatons, the result will not be love of life, but love of death.26

被压迫者被压迫的死亡氛围所塑造，他们必须通过斗争找到肯定生命的人性化之路，而这不仅仅在于吃得更多（尽管这确实涉及吃得更多，并且不能不包含这方面）。被压迫者之所以被摧毁，正是因为他们的处境使他们沦为物。为了恢复人性，他们必须不再是物，而是作为男人和女人去战斗。这是一个根本的要求。他们不能作为物参与斗争，以便日后成为人。

The oppressed, who have been shaped by the death-affirming climate of oppression, must find through their struggle the way to life-affirming humanization, which does not lie simply in having more to eat (although it does involve having more to eat and cannot fail to include this aspect). The oppressed have been destroyed ­precisely because their situation has reduced them to things. In order to regain their humanity they must cease to be things and fight as men and women. This is a radical requirement. They cannot enter the struggle as objects in order later to become human beings.

斗争始于人们认识到自己已被摧毁。宣传、管理、操纵——所有统治手段——都不能成为他们重新人性化的手段。唯一有效的手段是人性化的教育，革命领导层通过这种教育与被压迫者建立永久的对话关系。在人性化的教育中，方法不再是教师（在这里是革命领导）操纵学生（在这里是被压迫者）的工具，因为它表达了学生自己的意识。

The struggle begins with men’s recognition that they have been destroyed. Propaganda, management, manipulation—all arms of domination—cannot be the instruments of their rehumanization. The only effective instrument is a humanizing pedagogy in which the revolutionary leadership establishes a permanent relationship of dialogue with the oppressed. In a humanizing pedagogy the method ceases to be an instrument by which the teachers (in this instance, the revolutionary leadership) can manipulate the students (in this instance, the oppressed), because it expresses the consciousness of the students themselves.

方法实际上是意识在行为中表现出来的外在形式，它具有意识的基本属性——意向性。意识的本质是与世界同在，这种行为是永久的、不可避免的。因此，意识本质上是一种“通往”自身之外的某种事物的道路，它围绕着它，它通过其观念能力来理解它。因此，从定义上讲，意识是一种方法，从这个词最一般的意义上来说。27

The method is, in fact, the external form of consciousness mani­-fest in acts, which takes on the fundamental property of consciousness—its intentionality. The essence of consciousness is being with the world, and this behavior is permanent and un­-avoidable. Accordingly, consciousness is in essence a ‘way to-wards’ something apart from itself, outside itself, which ­surrounds it and which it apprehends by means of its ideational capacity. Consciousness is thus by definition a method, in the most general sense of the word.27

因此，革命领导必须实行共同关注的教育。教师和学生（领导和人民）共同关注现实，都是主体，不仅要揭示现实，从而批判性地了解现实，还要重新创造这种知识。当他们通过共同的反思和行动获得这种现实知识时，他们发现自己是现实的永久再创造者。这样，被压迫者在争取解放的斗争中的存在将是应有的：不是伪参与，而是坚定的参与。

A revolutionary leadership must accordingly practice co-inten­-tional education. Teachers and students (leadership and people), co-intent on reality, are both Subjects, not only in the task of ­unveiling that reality, and thereby coming to know it critically, but in the task of re-creating that knowledge. As they attain this knowledge of real­-ity through common reflection and action, they discover ­themselves as its permanent re-creators. In this way, the presence of the op-pressed in the struggle for their liberation will be what it should be: not pseudo-participation, but committed involvement.

笔记

Notes

1当前的反叛运动，尤其是青年人的反叛运动，虽然必然反映了各自环境的特点，但其本质却体现了对人作为世界上的存在物以及与世界的关系的关注——关注他们是什么以及如何“存在”。当他们评判消费文明、谴责各种官僚主义、要求大学变革（改变僵化的师生关系并将这种关系置于现实背景中）、提议改变现实本身以便大学能够焕然一新、攻击旧秩序和既定机构以试图确认人是决策的主体时，所有这些运动都反映了我们这个时代的风格，这种风格更多的是人类学的而不是人类中心的。

1 The current movements of rebellion, especially those of youth, while they necessarily reflect the peculiarities of their respective settings, manifest in their essence this preoccupation with people as beings in the world and with the world—preoccupation with what and how they are “being.” As they place consumer civiliza­-tion in judgment, denounce bureaucracies of all types, demand the transformation of the universities (changing the rigid nature of the teacher-student relationship and placing that relationship within the context of reality), propose the transformation of reality itself so that universities can be renewed, attack old orders and ­established ­institutions in the attempt to affirm human beings as the Subjects of decision, all these movements reflect the style of our age, which is more anthropological than anthropocentric.

2本书中使用的“矛盾”一词表示对立的社会力量之间的辩证冲突。——译者注。

2 As used throughout this book, the term “contradiction” denotes the dialectical conflict between opposing social forces.—Translator’s note.

3这种对自由的恐惧在压迫者身上也同样存在，尽管显然是以不同的形式。被压迫者害怕拥抱自由；压迫者害怕失去压迫的“自由”。

3 This fear of freedom is also to be found in the oppressors, though, obviously, in a different form. The oppressed are afraid to embrace freedom; the oppressors are afraid of losing the “freedom” to oppress.

4参见黑格尔，上文，第 236-237 页。

4 See Hegel, op. cit., pp. 236–237.

5黑格尔分析了主人意识和被压迫者意识的辩证关系，他说：“前者是独立的，它的本质是自为；后者是从属的，它的本质是为他人而生存。前者是主人或领主，后者是奴隶。”同上，第234页。

5 Analyzing the dialectical relationship between the consciousness of the ­master and the consciousness of the oppressed, Hegel states: “The one is independent, and its essential nature is to be for itself; the other is dependent, and its essence is life or existence for another. The former is the Master, or Lord, the latter the ­Bondsman.” Ibid., p. 234.

6 “解放行动必然涉及感知和意志的时刻。这一行动既先于这一时刻，又在其后，它首先充当这一时刻的序幕，随后又影响并延续历史。然而，统治行动并不一定意味着这一维度；因为统治结构是由其自身的机械和无意识功能维持的。”摘自何塞·路易斯·菲奥里 (José Luiz Fiori) 的一部未发表的作品，他已获准引用他的话。

6 “Liberating action necessarily involves a moment of perception and ­volition. This action both precedes and follows that moment, to which it first acts as a ­prologue and which it subsequently serves to effect and continue within history. The action of domination, however, does not necessarily imply this dimension; for the structure of domination is maintained by its own mechanical and ­unconscious ­functionality.” From an unpublished work by José Luiz Fiori, who has kindly granted permission to quote him.

7卡尔·马克思和弗里德里希·恩格斯，《La Sagrada Familia y otros Escritos》（墨西哥，1962 年），第 14 页。 6. 强调。

7 Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels, La Sagrada Familia y otros Escritos (Mexico, 1962), p. 6. Emphasis added.

8 Georg Lukács，Lénine（巴黎，1965 年），第 14 页。 62.

8 Georg Lukács, Lénine (Paris, 1965), p. 62.

9 “唯物主义学说认为，人是环境和教养的产物，因此，改变的人是其他环境和改变的教养的产物，这种学说忘记了，改变环境的是人，而教育者本身也需要教育。”《卡尔·马克思和弗里德里希·恩格斯选集》 （纽约，1968 年），第 28 页。

9 “The materialist doctrine that men are products of circumstances and up­-bringing, and that, therefore, changed men are products of other circumstances and changed upbringing, forgets that it is men that change circumstances and that the educator himself needs educating.” Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels, Selected Works (New York, 1968), p. 28.

10这似乎是毛泽东文化大革命的根本方面。

10 This appears to be the fundamental aspect of Mao’s Cultural Revolution.

11这种僵化不应等同于对前压迫者施加的限制，以使他们无法恢复压迫秩序。相反，它指的是革命陷入停滞，并利用旧的压制性官僚国家机器（正如马克思经常强调的那样，应该彻底镇压这种机器）来反对人民。

11 This rigidity should not be identified with the restraints that must be im-posed on the former oppressors so they cannot restore the oppressive order. Rather, it refers to the revolution which becomes stagnant and turns against the ­people, using the old repressive, bureaucratic State apparatus (which should have been ­drastically suppressed, as Marx so often emphasized).

12埃里希·弗洛姆，《人的心》（纽约，1966 年），第 32 页。

12 Erich Fromm, The Heart of Man (New York, 1966), p. 32.

13关于“社会控制的主导形式”，请参阅赫伯特·马尔库塞，《单向度的人》（波士顿，1964 年）和《爱欲与文明》（波士顿，1955 年）。

13 Regarding the “dominant forms of social control,” see Herbert Marcuse, ­One-Dimensional Man (Boston, 1964) and Eros and Civilization (Boston, 1955).

14一位农民在接受作者采访时说的话。

14 Words of a peasant during an interview with the author.

15参见 Candido Mendes，《Memento dos vivos——A Esquerda católica no Brasil》（里约热内卢，1966 年）。

15 See Candido Mendes, Memento dos vivos—A Esquerda católica no Brasil (Rio, 1966).

16弗朗茨·法农，《大地上受苦的人》（纽约，1968 年），第 52 页。

16 Frantz Fanon, The Wretched of the Earth (New York, 1968), p. 52.

17《殖民者与被殖民者》（波士顿，1967 年）

17 The Colonizer and the Colonized (Boston, 1967), p. x.

18一位农民在接受作者采访时说的话。

18 Words of a peasant during an interview with the author.

19请参阅第 3 章，第 113 页及后续页——译者注。

19 See chapter 3, p. 113 ff.—Translator’s note.

20 Asentamiento 是智利土地改革实验的生产单位。——译者注。

20 Asentamiento refers to a production unit of the Chilean agrarian reform ­experiment.—Translator’s note.

21 “农民对老板几乎有一种本能的恐惧。”对一位农民的采访。

21 “The peasant has an almost instinctive fear of the boss.” Interview with a peasant.

22请参阅雷吉斯·德布雷，《革命中的革命？》（纽约，1967 年）。

22 See Regis Debray, Revolution in the Revolution? (New York, 1967).

23与一位农民的访谈。

23 Interview with a peasant.

24当然不能公开进行；那只会激起压迫者的愤怒，并导致更严厉的镇压。

24 Not in the open, of course; that would only provoke the fury of the oppressor and lead to still greater repression.

25这些观点将在第 4 章中详细讨论。

25 These points will be discussed at length in chapter 4.

26弗洛姆，同上。引文，第 52-53 页。

26 Fromm, op. cit., pp. 52–53.

27 Alvaro Vieira Pinto，摘自正在准备的科学哲学著作。我认为所引用的部分对于理解问题提出式教学法（将在第 2 章中介绍）非常重要，并感谢 Vieira Pinto 教授允许我在出版前引用他的作品。

27 Alvaro Vieira Pinto, from a work in preparation on the philosophy of science. I consider the quoted portion of great importance for the understanding of a prob­-lem-posing pedagogy (to be presented in chapter 2), and wish to thank Professor Vieira Pinto for permission to cite his work prior to publication.

章

CHAPTER

2

2

仔细分析学校内外任何层次的师生关系，就会发现其本质上具有叙事性。这种关系涉及叙述主体（教师）和耐心倾听的对象（学生）。内容，无论是价值观还是现实的经验维度，在叙述过程中往往变得毫无生气和僵化。教育正遭受叙述病的折磨。

A careful analysis of the teacher-student relationship at any level, inside or outside the school, reveals its fundamen-tally narrative character. This relationship involves a nar­-rating Subject (the teacher) and patient, listening objects (the ­students). The contents, whether values or empirical dimensions of reality, tend in the process of being narrated to become lifeless and petrified. Education is suffering from narration sickness.

老师谈论现实时，好像它是静止的、静态的、条块分割的、可预测的。或者，他阐述的话题与学生的存在体验完全不同。他的任务是向学生“填充”他所讲述的内容——这些内容脱离了现实，与产生这些内容并赋予它们意义的整体脱节。词语被抽空了其具体性，变成了空洞的、异化的、令人疏远的冗长话语。

The teacher talks about reality as if it were motionless, static, ­compartmentalized, and predictable. Or else he expounds on a topic completely alien to the existential experience of the students. His task is to “fill” the students with the contents of his narration—­contents which are detached from reality, disconnected from the totality that engendered them and could give them significance. Words are emptied of their concreteness and become a hollow, alienated, and alienating verbosity.

因此，这种叙事教育的突出特点是词语的响亮性，而不是其转化力。“四乘以四等于十六；帕拉州的首府是贝伦。”学生记录、记忆和重复这些短语，却没有意识到四乘以四的真正含义，也没有意识到“帕拉州的首府是贝伦”这一肯定句中“首府”的真正含义，即贝伦对帕拉州意味着什么，帕拉州对巴西意味着什么。

The outstanding characteristic of this narrative education, then, is the sonority of words, not their transforming power. “Four times four is sixteen; the capital of Pará is Belém.” The student records, memorizes, and repeats these phrases without perceiving what four times four really means, or realizing the true significance of “capital” in the affirmation “the capital of Pará is Belém,” that is, what Belém means for Pará and what Pará means for Brazil.

叙述（由老师担任叙述者）引导学生机械地记住所叙述的内容。更糟糕的是，它把他们变成“容器”，变成老师要“填满”的“容器”。她填得越满，她就是一个好老师。容器越温顺地允许自己被填满，他们就是好学生。

Narration (with the teacher as narrator) leads the students to memorize mechanically the narrated content. Worse yet, it turns them into “containers,” into “receptacles” to be “filled” by the teacher. The more completely she fills the receptacles, the better a teacher she is. The more meekly the receptacles permit themselves to be filled, the better students they are.

因此，教育成为一种存放行为，其中学生是存放者，教师是存放者。教师不是交流，而是发布公报并进行存放，学生耐心地接收、记忆和重复。这是教育的“银行”概念，其中允许学生采取行动的范围仅限于接收、归档和存储存款。他们确实有机会成为他们存储的东西的收藏家或编目员。但归根结底，由于缺乏创造力、变革和知识，在这个（充其量）被误导的系统中，被存放起来的是人自己。因为除了探究，除了实践，个人不可能是真正的人。知识只有通过发明和再发明，通过人类在世界上、与世界和彼此之间进行的不安、不耐烦、持续、充满希望的探究才能出现。

Education thus becomes an act of depositing, in which the students are the depositories and the teacher is the depositor. Instead of communicating, the teacher issues communiqués and makes de-posits which the students patiently receive, memorize, and repeat. This is the “banking” concept of education, in which the scope of action allowed to the students extends only as far as receiving, ­filing, and storing the deposits. They do, it is true, have the opportunity to become collectors or cataloguers of the things they store. But in the last analysis, it is the people themselves who are filed away through the lack of creativity, transformation, and knowledge in this (at best) misguided system. For apart from inquiry, apart from the praxis, individuals cannot be truly human. Knowledge emerges only through invention and re-invention, through the restless, impatient, continuing, hopeful inquiry human beings pursue in the world, with the world, and with each other.

在教育的灌输概念中，知识是那些自认为知识渊博的人赠予那些他们认为一无所知的人的礼物。将绝对的无知投射到他人身上，这是压迫意识形态的一个特征，它否定了教育和知识作为探究过程。教师将自己呈现为学生的必然对立面；通过将他们的无知视为绝对的，他为自己的存在辩护。学生像黑格尔辩证法中的奴隶一样被疏远，他们接受自己的无知来证明教师的存在是合理的——但与奴隶不同的是，他们从未发现他们教育了教师。

In the banking concept of education, knowledge is a gift bestowed by those who consider themselves knowledgeable upon those whom they consider to know nothing. Projecting an absolute ignorance onto others, a characteristic of the ideology of oppression, negates education and knowledge as processes of inquiry. The teacher presents himself to his students as their necessary opposite; by consid­ering their ignorance absolute, he justifies his own existence. The students, alienated like the slave in the Hegelian dialectic, accept their ignorance as justifying the teacher’s existence—but, unlike the slave, they never discover that they educate the teacher.

而自由主义教育存在的理由则在于其追求和解。教育必须从解决师生矛盾开始，通过和解矛盾的两极，使双方同时成为老师和学生。

The raison d’être of libertarian education, on the other hand, lies in its drive towards reconciliation. Education must begin with the solution of the teacher-student contradiction, by reconciling the poles of the contradiction so that both are simultaneously teachers and students.

这种解决方案并不（也不可能）存在于灌输式教育理念中。相反，灌输式教育通过以下态度和做法维持甚至刺激了这种矛盾，这些态度和做法反映了整个压迫性社会：

This solution is not (nor can it be) found in the banking concept. On the contrary, banking education maintains and even stimulates the contradiction through the following attitudes and practices, which mirror oppressive society as a whole:

（a）老师教书，学生受教；

(a) the teacher teaches and the students are taught;

（b）老师什么都知道，而学生却什么都不知道；

(b) the teacher knows everything and the students know nothing;

（三）老师想着，学生也想着；

(c) the teacher thinks and the students are thought about;

（d）老师讲，学生听——温顺；

(d) the teacher talks and the students listen—meekly;

（五）教师严守纪律，学生也受纪律处分；

(e) the teacher disciplines and the students are disciplined;

（f）老师做出选择并执行自己的选择，学生遵守；

(f) the teacher chooses and enforces his choice, and the students comply;

（g）老师采取行动，学生通过老师的行动产生采取行动的错觉；

(g) the teacher acts and the students have the illusion of acting through the action of the teacher;

(h) 老师选择课程内容，学生（没有经过咨询）适应课程内容；

(h) the teacher chooses the program content, and the students (who were not consulted) adapt to it;

（i）教师混淆了知识的权威和他或她自己的专业权威，将知识的权威和他或她自己的专业权威与学生的自由对立起来；

(i) the teacher confuses the authority of knowledge with his or her own professional authority, which she and he sets in oppo­sition to the freedom of the students;

（j）教师是学习过程的主体，而学生仅仅是对象。

(j) the teacher is the Subject of the learning process, while the pupils are mere objects.

毫不奇怪，教育的银行概念将人视为适应性强、易于管理的生物。学生越是努力储存托付给他们的存款，他们就越不会发展出批判意识，而这种批判意识是他们作为世界改造者介入世界所产生的。他们越是完全接受强加给他们的被动角色，就越倾向于简单地适应世界现状和他们所持有的支离破碎的现实观。

It is not surprising that the banking concept of education regards men as adaptable, manageable beings. The more students work at storing the deposits entrusted to them, the less they develop the critical consciousness which would result from their intervention in the world as transformers of that world. The more completely they accept the passive role imposed on them, the more they tend simply to adapt to the world as it is and to the fragmented view of reality deposited in them.

教育可以削弱或消除学生的创造力，并刺激他们的轻信，这种能力符合压迫者的利益，他们既不关心世界被揭示，也不关心世界被改变。压迫者利用他们的“人道主义”来维持有利可图的局面。因此，他们几乎本能地反对任何刺激学生创造力的教育实验批判能力，不满足于对现实的片面看法，而总是寻找将一个点与另一个点、一个问题与另一个问题联系起来的联系。

The capability of banking education to minimize or annul the students’ creative power and to stimulate their credulity serves the interests of the oppressors, who care neither to have the world re-vealed nor to see it transformed. The oppressors use their “humanitarianism” to preserve a profitable situation. Thus they react almost instinctively against any experiment in education which stimulates the critical faculties and is not content with a partial view of reality but always seeks out the ties which link one point to another and one problem to another.

事实上，压迫者的兴趣在于“改变被压迫者的意识，而不是改变压迫他们的处境”；因为 被压迫者越能适应这种处境，他们就越容易被统治。为了达到这个目的，压迫者将教育的银行概念与家长式的社会行动机构结合起来，在这个机构中，被压迫者被委婉地称为“福利接受者”。他们被视为个案，是偏离“良好、有组织、公正”社会总体结构的边缘人。被压迫者被视为健康社会的病态，因此，健康社会必须通过改变这些“无能和懒惰”的人的心态，使他们适应自己的模式。这些边缘人需要被“整合”、“纳入”到他们“抛弃”的健康社会中。

Indeed, the interests of the oppressors lie in “changing the consciousness of the oppressed, not the situation which oppresses them”;1 for the more the oppressed can be led to adapt to that ­situation, the more easily they can be dominated. To achieve this end, the oppressors use the banking concept of education in conjunction with a paternalistic social action apparatus, within which the oppressed receive the euphemistic ti tle of “welfare recipients.” They are treated as individual cases, as marginal persons who deviate from the general configuration of a “good, organized, and just” society. The oppressed are regarded as the pathology of the healthy society, which must therefore adjust these “incompetent and lazy” folk to its own patterns by changing their mentality. These marginals need to be “integrated,” “incorporated” into the healthy society that they have “forsaken.”

但事实是，被压迫者不是“边缘人”，不是生活在社会“之外”的人。他们一直处于“内部”——处于使他们成为“他人之人”的结构之中。解决方案不是将他们“整合”到压迫结构中，而是改造该结构，使他们能够成为“为自己之人”。当然，这种改造会破坏压迫者的目的；因此他们利用教育灌输概念来避免学生意识觉醒的威胁。

The truth is, however, that the oppressed are not ­“marginals,” are not people living “outside” society. They have always been “inside”—inside the structure which made them “beings for others.” The ­solution is not to “integrate” them into the structure of oppression, but to transform that structure so that they can become “beings for themselves.” Such transformation, of course, would undermine the oppressors’ purposes; hence their utilization of the banking concept of education to avoid the threat of student conscientização.

例如，成人教育的灌输式方法永远不会建议学生批判性地思考现实。相反，它只会处理诸如罗杰是否给了山羊青草这样的重要问题，并强调学习的重要性，而事实恰恰相反，罗杰给了兔子青草。灌输式方法的“人文主义”掩盖了将女性和男性变成机器人的努力——这恰恰否定了他们成为更完整的人这一本体论使命。

The banking approach to adult education, for example, will never propose to students that they critically consider reality. It will deal instead with such vital questions as whether Roger gave green grass to the goat, and insist upon the importance of learning that, on the contrary, Roger gave green grass to the rabbit. The “humanism” of the banking approach masks the effort to turn women and men into automatons—the very negation of their ontological vocation to be more fully human.

那些有意或无意地使用银行式教学方法的人（因为有无数善意的银行职员教师没有意识到他们只会使人失去人性），没有意识到存款本身包含与现实相矛盾的内容。但是，这些矛盾迟早会导致以前被动的学生反对他们的驯化和驯化现实的尝试。他们可能会通过生存经验发现，他们目前的生活方式与他们成为完全人性的使命是不可调和的。他们可能会通过与现实的关系认识到现实实际上是一个不断变化过程。如果男人和女人都是探索者，他们的本体论使命是人性化，那么他们迟早会意识到银行式教育试图维持他们的矛盾，然后投身于解放的斗争中。

Those who use the banking approach, knowingly or ­unknowingly (for there are innumerable well-intentioned bank-clerk teachers who do not realize that they are serving only to dehumanize), fail to perceive that the deposits themselves contain contradictions about reality. But, sooner or later, these contradictions may lead formerly passive students to turn against their domestication and the attempt to domesticate reality. They may discover through existential experience that their present way of life is irreconcilable with their voca­-tion to become fully human. They may perceive through their ­relations with reality that reality is really a process, undergoing ­constant transformation. If men and women are searchers and their ontological vocation is humanization, sooner or later they may perceive the contradiction in which banking education seeks to maintain them, and then engage themselves in the struggle for their ­liberation.

但人文主义、革命性的教育家不能等待这种可能性的实现。从一开始，她的努力就必须与学生的努力相一致，进行批判性思考，寻求相互人性化。他的努力必须充满对人及其创造力的深刻信任。为了实现这一点，他们必须成为学生关系中的伙伴。

But the humanist, revolutionary educator cannot wait for this pos­sibility to materialize. From the outset, her efforts must coincide with those of the students to engage in critical thinking and the quest for mutual humanization. His efforts must be imbued with a profound trust in people and their creative power. To achieve this, they must be partners of the students in their relations with them.

银行概念不允许这种伙伴关系——而且必然如此。解决师生矛盾，将存款人、处方人、驯化者的角色换成学生中学生的角色，将会削弱压迫力量，并服务于解放事业。

The banking concept does not admit to such partnership—and necessarily so. To resolve the teacher-student contradiction, to ex-change the role of depositor, prescriber, domesticator, for the role of student among students would be to undermine the power of oppression and serve the cause of liberation.

银行概念隐含着人类与世界二分法的假设：人只是存在于世界之中，而不是与世界或他人同在；个人是旁观者，而不是再创造者。从这个角度来看，人不是有意识的存在（corpo consciente ）；他或她更像是意识的拥有者：一个空洞的“心灵”，被动地接受来自外部世界的现实存款。例如，我的书桌、我的书、我的咖啡杯、我面前的所有物体——作为我周围世界的碎片——都将“在我体内”，就像我在我体内一样。现在就研究。这种观点没有区分可进入意识和进入意识。然而，这种区别是至关重要的：我周围的物体只是我的意识可以进入，而不是位于我的意识之中。我知道它们，但它们不在我的内心。

Implicit in the banking concept is the assumption of a dichotomy between human beings and the world: a person is merely in the world, not with the world or with others; the individual is ­spectator, not re-creator. In this view, the person is not a conscious being (corpo consciente); he or she is rather the possessor of a consciousness: an empty “mind” passively open to the reception of deposits of reality from the world outside. For example, my desk, my books, my coffee cup, all the objects before me—as bits of the world which surround me—would be “inside” me, exactly as I am inside my study right now. This view makes no distinction between being ac-cessible to consciousness and entering consciousness. The distinction, however, is essential: the objects which surround me are simply accessible to my consciousness, not located within it. I am aware of them, but they are not inside me.

从意识灌输概念可以逻辑地得出，教育者的角色是规范世界“进入”学生的方式。教师的任务是组织一个已经自发发生的过程，通过储存他或她认为构成真正知识的信息来“填充”学生。2 既然人们以被动的方式“接受”世界，教育就应该让他们变得更加被动，并使他们适应世界。受过教育的人是适应者，因为他或她更 “适应”这个世界。付诸实践，这个概念非常适合压迫者的目的，他们的平静取决于人们如何适应压迫者创造的世界，以及他们有多么少质疑这个世界。

It follows logically from the banking notion of consciousness that the educator’s role is to regulate the way the world “enters into” the students. The teacher’s task is to organize a process which already occurs spontaneously, to “fill” the students by making deposits of information which he or she considers to constitute true knowledge.2 And since people “receive” the world as passive entities, education should make them more passive still, and adapt them to the world. The educated individual is the adapted person, because she or he is better “fit” for the world. Translated into practice, this concept is well suited to the purposes of the oppressors, whose tranquility rests on how well people fit the world the oppressors have created, and how little they question it.

多数人越是完全适应占统治地位的少数人为他们规定的目标（从而剥夺了他们实现自己目标的权利），少数人就越容易继续规定。灌输式教育的理论和实践非常有效地实现了这一目标。口头课程、阅读要求、3 评估“知识”的方法、教师与受教者之间的距离、晋升标准：这种现成的方法中的一切都是为了避免思考。

The more completely the majority adapt to the purposes which the dominant minority prescribe for them (thereby depriving them of the right to their own purposes), the more easily the ­minority can continue to prescribe. The theory and practice of banking ­education serve this end quite efficiently. Verbalistic lessons, reading require­ments,3 the methods for evaluating “knowledge,” the distance be-tween the teacher and the taught, the criteria for promotion: ­everything in this ready-to-wear approach serves to obviate ­thinking.

银行职员教育者没有意识到，在他过度膨胀的角色中没有真正的安全感，一个人必须寻求与他人团结一致地生活。一个人不能强加自己，甚至不能仅仅与学生共存。团结需要真正的交流，而指导这种教育的理念却惧怕和禁止交流。

The bank-clerk educator does not realize that there is no true ­security in his hypertrophied role, that one must seek to live with others in solidarity. One cannot impose oneself, nor even merely ­co-exist with one’s students. Solidarity requires true communica-tion, and the concept by which such an educator is guided fears and proscribes communication.

然而，只有通过交流，人类生活才有意义。教师的思想只有通过学生思想的真实性才能得到验证。教师不能代替学生思考，也不能把自己的思想强加给他们。真实的思考，即关注现实的思考，不是在象牙塔中孤立地发生的，而只有在交流中才能发生。如果思想只有在对世界的行动中产生时才有意义，那么学生对教师的服从就是不可能的。

Yet only through communication can human life hold meaning. The teacher’s thinking is authenticated only by the authenticity of the students’ thinking. The teacher cannot think for her students, nor can she impose her thought on them. Authentic thinking, thinking that is concerned about reality, does not take place in ivory tower isolation, but only in communication. If it is true that thought has meaning only when generated by actio n upon the world, the subordination of students to teachers becomes impossible.

由于灌输教育始于对男人和女人作为物体的错误理解，它无法促进弗洛姆所说的“亲生命性”的发展，反而会产生其对立面：“亲尸性”。

Because banking education begins with a false understanding of men and women as objects, it cannot promote the development of what Fromm calls “biophily,” but instead produces its opposite: “necrophily.”

生命以结构化、功能性的方式生长为特征，而恋尸癖者则热爱一切不生长的、机械的东西。恋尸癖者渴望将有机物转化为无机物，机械地对待生命，好像所有活着的人都是物品……记忆，而不是经验；拥有，而不是存在，才是最重要的。恋尸癖者只有在拥有某样东西（一朵花或一个人）时才能与它产生联系；因此，对他拥有的东西的威胁就是对他自己的威胁；如果他失去拥有的东西，他就失去了与世界的联系……他喜欢控制，在控制的过程中，他扼杀了生命。4

While life is characterized by growth in a structured, functional manner, the necrophilous person loves all that does not grow, all that is mechanical. The necrophilous person is driven by the desire to transform the organic into the inorganic, to approach life mechanically, as if all living persons were things. . . . Mem-ory, rather than experience; having, rather than being, is what counts. The necrophilous person can relate to an object—a flower or a person—only if he possesses it; hence a threat to his possession is a threat to himself; if he loses possession he loses contact with the world. . . . He loves control, and in the act of ­controlling he kills life.4

压迫——压倒性的控制——是恋尸癖；它滋生于对死亡而非生命的热爱。服务于压迫利益的银行式教育理念也是恋尸癖。它基于机械、静态、自然主义、空间化的意识观，将学生变成接受对象。它试图控制思想和行动，引导女性和男性适应世界，并抑制他们的创造力。

Oppression—overwhelming control—is necrophilic; it is nourished by love of death, not life. The banking concept of education, which serves the interests of oppression, is also necrophilic. Based on a mechanistic, static, naturalistic, spatialized view of consciousness, it transforms students into receiving objects. It attempts to control thinking and action, leads women and men to adjust to the world, and inhibits their creative power.

当人们努力负责任地行动却受挫，当他们发现自己无法使用自己的能力时，他们就会受苦。“这种因无能为力而产生的痛苦，根源在于人类的平衡被打破了。” 5 但导致人们痛苦的无能为力也导致他们拒绝自己的无能为力，试图

When their efforts to act responsibly are frustrated, when they find themselves unable to use their faculties, people suffer. “This ­suffering due to impotence is rooted in the very fact that the human ­equilibrium has been disturbed.”5 But the inability to act which causes people’s anguish also causes them to reject their impotence, by attempting

……恢复行动能力。但他们能做到吗？又如何做到？一种方法是服从和认同一个拥有权力的人或团体。通过这种象征性地参与他人的生活，人们产生了行动的幻觉，而实际上他们只是服从并成为行动者的一部分。6

. . . to restore [their] capacity to act. But can [they], and how? One way is to submit to and identify with a person or group ­having power. By this symbolic participation in another person’s life, [men have] the illusion of acting, when in reality [they] only submit to and become a part of those who act.6

民粹主义的表现或许最能体现被压迫者的这种行为，他们通过认同魅力型领导人，开始觉得自己是积极有效的。他们在历史进程中出现的反抗，正是出于这种有效行动的愿望。占统治地位的精英认为，解决办法是更多的统治和镇压，以自由、秩序和社会和平（即精英的和平）的名义进行。因此，从他们的角度来看，他们可以合乎逻辑地谴责“工人罢工的暴力行为，并同时呼吁国家使用暴力镇压罢工。” 7

Populist manifestations perhaps best exemplify this type of behavior by the oppressed, who, by identifying with charismatic leaders, come to feel that they themselves are active and effective. The rebellion they express as they emerge in the historical process is motivated by that desire to act effectively. The dominant elites consider the remedy to be more domination and repression, carried out in the name of freedom, order, and social peace (that is, the peace of the elites). Thus they can condemn—logically, from their point of view—“the violence of a strike by workers and [can] call upon the state in the same breath to use violence in putting down the strike.”7

教育作为一种统治手段，刺激学生轻信，其意识形态意图（教育者往往没有意识到）是灌输他们适应压迫世界。这种指责并非天真地希望统治精英会因此而放弃这种做法。其目的是提醒真正的人文主义者注意，他们不能使用灌输式教育方法来追求解放，因为这只会否定这种追求。革命社会也不能从压迫社会继承这些方法。实行灌输式教育的革命社会要么被误导，要么不信任人民。无论哪种情况，它都受到反动幽灵的威胁。

Education as the exercise of domination stimulates the credulity of students, with the ideological intent (often not perceived by educators) of indoctrinating them to adapt to the world of oppression. This accusation is not made in the naïve hope that the dominant elites will thereby simply abandon the practice. Its objective is to call the attention of true humanists to the fact that they cannot use banking educational methods in the pursuit of liberation, for they would only negate that very pursuit. Nor may a revolutionary society inherit these methods from an oppressor society. The revolutionary society which practices banking education is either misguided or mistrusting of people. In either event, it is threatened by the specter of reaction.

不幸的是，那些支持解放事业的人本身也被银行化概念的氛围所包围和影响，他们往往没有意识到它的真正意义或其非人性化的力量。矛盾的是，他们在他们所认为的解放努力中利用了同样的疏远手段。事实上，一些“革命者”把那些挑战这种教育实践的人称为“无辜者”、“梦想家”甚至“反动派”。但人们不能通过疏远他们来解放他们。真正的解放——人性化的过程——不是在人身上再存一笔钱。解放是一种实践：男人和女人对他们的世界采取行动和反思，以改变它。那些真正致力于解放事业的人既不能接受意识是一个需要填满的空容器的机械概念，也不能接受以解放的名义使用银行化统治方法（宣传、口号——存款）。

Unfortunately, those who espouse the cause of liberation are themselves surrounded and influenced by the climate which generates the banking concept, and often do not perceive its true significance or its dehumanizing power. Paradoxically, then, they utilize this same instrument of alienation in what they consider an effort to liberate. Indeed, some “revolutionaries” brand as “innocents,” “dreamers,” or even “reactionaries” those who would challenge this educational practice. But one does not liberate people by alienating them. Authentic liberation—the process of humanization—is not another deposit to be made in men. Liberation is a praxis: the action and reflection of men and women upon their world in order to ­transform it. Those truly committed to the cause of liberation can accept neither the mechanistic concept of consciousness as an empty vessel to be filled, nor the use of banking methods of domination (propaganda, slogans—deposits) in the name of liberation.

那些真正致力于解放的人必须完全拒绝银行概念，而采用一种将女性和男性视为有意识的存在，并将意识视为专注于世界的意识的概念。他们必须放弃存款的教育目标，代之以提出人类与世界关系中的问题。“问题提出式”教育响应了意识的本质——意向性——拒绝公报并体现沟通。它体现了意识的特殊特征：不仅意识到专注于对象，而且意识到在雅斯佩里式的“分裂”中转向自身——意识作为意识的意识。

Those truly committed to liberation must reject the banking concept in its entirety, adopting instead a concept of women and men as conscious beings, and consciousness as consciousness intent upon the world. They must abandon the educational goal of deposit-mak­ing and replace it with the posing of the problems of human beings in their relations with the world. “Problem-posing” education, re-sponding to the essence of consciousness—intentionality—rejects communiqués and embodies communication. It epitomizes the special characteristic of consciousness: being conscious of, not only as intent on objects but as turned in upon itself in a Jasperian “split”—consciousness as consciousness of consciousness.

解放教育在于认知行为，而不是信息传递。这是一种学习情境，其中可认知的对象（远非认知行为的终点）是认知行为主体——一方面是教师，另一方面是学生——的中介。因此，问题提出式教育的实践从一开始就需要解决师生矛盾。对话关系——认知能力不可或缺的因素——是学习者与学生之间的桥梁。参与者相互合作感知同一个可认知对象——否则就不可能实现。

Liberating education consists in acts of cognition, not ­transferrals of information. It is a learning situation in which the cognizable object (far from being the end of the cognitive act) intermediates the cognitive actors—teacher on the one hand and students on the other. Accordingly, the practice of problem-posing education entails at the outset that the teacher-student contradiction to be resolved. Dialogical relations—indispensable to the capacity of cognitive actors to cooperate in perceiving the same cognizable object—are otherwise impossible.

事实上，问题提出式教育打破了灌输式教育特有的垂直模式，只有克服上述矛盾，才能发挥其实践自由的功能。通过对话，学生的老师和学生的老师不再存在，出现了一个新的术语：师生与学生的老师。老师不再仅仅是教书的人，而是在与学生对话中被教的人，而学生在被教的同时也在教书。他们共同负责一个所有人都成长的过程。在这个过程中，基于“权威”的论点不再有效；为了发挥作用，权威必须站在自由一边，而不是反对自由。在这里，没有人教别人，也没有人自学。人们通过世界、通过灌输式教育中教师“拥有”的可认知对象相互教导。

Indeed, problem-posing education, which breaks with the ­vertical patterns characteristic of banking education, can fulfill its function as the practice of freedom only if it can overcome the above contradiction. Through dialogue, the teacher-of-the-students and the students-of-the-teacher cease to exist and a new term emerges: teacher-student with students-teachers. The teacher is no longer merely the-one-who-teaches, but one who is himself taught in dialogue with the students, who in turn while being taught also teach. They be-come jointly responsible for a process in which all grow. In this ­process, arguments based on “authority” are no longer valid; in order to function, authority must be on the side of freedom, not against it. Here, no one teaches another, nor is any one self-taught. People teach each other, mediated by the world, by the cognizable objects which in banking education are “owned” by the teacher.

灌输概念（具有将一切二分的倾向）将教育者的行为分为两个阶段。在第一阶段，他在书房或实验室备课时认知一个可认知的对象；在第二阶段，他向学生讲解该对象。学生不需要知道，而是记住老师讲述的内容。学生也不进行任何认知行为，因为该行为应该针对的对象是老师的财产，而不是引起老师和学生批判性反思的媒介。因此，以“保存文化和知识”的名义，我们有一个既没有实现真正知识也没有实现真正文化的系统。

The banking concept (with its tendency to dichotomize everything) distinguishes two stages in the action of the educator. During the first, he cognizes a cognizable object while he prepares his lessons in his study or his laboratory; during the second, he expounds to his students about that object. The students are not called upon to know, but to memorize the contents narrated by the teacher. Nor do the ­students practice any act of cognition, since the object to-wards which that act should be directed is the property of the teacher rather than a medium evoking the critical reflection of both teacher and students. Hence in the name of the “preservation of ­culture and knowledge” we have a system which achieves neither true knowledge nor true culture.

问题提出法并不将师生的活动二分：她并不是在某一时刻“认知”，而在另一时刻“叙述”。她始终是“认知”的，无论是准备项目还是与学生对话。他不把可认知的对象视为自己的私有财产，而是将其视为自己和学生反思的对象。这样，问题提出法教育者不断地在反思中重新形成自己的反思学生。学生不再是温顺的听众，而是与老师对话的批判性共同调查者。老师将材料呈现给学生供他们考虑，并在学生表达自己的想法时重新考虑她之前的考虑。提出问题的教育者的作用是与学生一起创造条件，在这些条件下，信念层面的知识被逻辑层面的真知所取代。

The problem-posing method does not dichotomize the ­activity of the teacher-student: she is not “cognitive” at one point and “narrative” at another. She is always “cognitive,” whether preparing a proj­ect or engaging in dialogue with the students. He does not regard ­cognizable objects as his private property, but as the object of re-flection by himself and the students. In this way, the problem-posing ­educator constantly re-forms his reflections in the reflection of the students. The students—no longer docile listeners—are now critical co-investigators in dialogue with the teacher. The teacher presents the material to the students for their consideration, and ­re-considers her earlier considerations as the students express their own. The role of the problem-posing educator is to create; together with the students, the conditions under which knowledge at the level of the doxa is superseded by true knowledge, at the level of the logos.

灌输式教育会麻痹和抑制创造力，而问题式教育则不断揭示现实。前者试图保持意识的沉没，而后者则力求意识的浮现和对现实的批判性干预。

Whereas banking education anesthetizes and inhibits creative power, problem-posing education involves a constant unveiling of reality. The former attempts to maintain the submersion of consciousness; the latter strives for the emergence of consciousness and critical intervention in reality.

随着学生越来越多地面临与自己有关的问题，他们将会越来越感到挑战，并有义务去应对这些挑战。因为他们将挑战理解为与整个背景下的其他问题相互关联，而不是理论问题，因此，由此产生的理解往往越来越具有批判性，因此疏离感也越来越少。他们对挑战的回应引发了新的挑战，随后是新的理解；学生们逐渐认为自己做出了承诺。

Students, as they are increasingly posed with problems relating to themselves in the world and with the world, will feel ­increasingly challenged and obliged to respond to that challenge. Because they apprehend the challenge as interrelated to other problems within a total context, not as a theoretical question, the resulting comprehen­sion tends to be increasingly critical and thus constantly less alien­ated. Their response to the challenge evokes new challenges, ­followed by new understandings; and gradually the students come to regard themselves as committed.

教育是自由的实践，与教育是统治的实践相反，它否认人是抽象的、孤立的、独立的、与世界无关的；它也否认世界是脱离人而存在的现实。真实的反思既不考虑抽象的人，也不考虑没有人的世界，而是考虑人与世界的关系。在这些关系中，意识和世界是同时的：意识既不先于世界，也不跟随世界。

Education as the practice of freedom—as opposed to education as the practice of domination—denies that man is abstract, isolated, independent, and unattached to the world; it also denies that the world exists as a reality apart from people. Authentic reflection considers neither abstract man nor the world without people, but peo-ple in their relations with the world. In these relations ­consciousness and world are simultaneous: consciousness neither precedes the world nor follows it.

《良心与世界》的妙招是：良心的本质是外在，世界的本质是自由。8

La conscience et le monde sont donnés d’un même coup: exté­-rieur par essence à la conscience, le monde est, par essence re­-latif à elle.8

在智利的一个文化圈中，大家正在讨论（基于法典9 ）人类学的文化概念。在讨论中，一位按照银行标准完全无知的农民说：“现在我明白了，没有人就没有世界。”当教育家回答说：“为了论证的目的，假设地球上所有的人都会死，但地球本身仍然存在，还有树木、鸟类、动物、河流、海洋、星星……这一切不就是一个世界吗？”“哦，不，”农民强调道。“没有人会说：‘这是一个世界’。”

In one of our culture circles in Chile, the group was discussing (based on a codification9 ) the anthropological concept of culture. In the midst of the discussion, a peasant who by banking standards was completely ignorant said: “Now I see that without man there is no world.” When the educator responded: “Let’s say, for the sake of ­argument, that all the men on earth were to die, but that the earth itself remained, together with trees, birds, animals, rivers, seas, the stars . . . wouldn’t all this be a world?” “Oh no,” the peasant replied emphatically. “There would be no one to say: ‘This is a world’.”

农民想表达这样一种观点：缺乏世界意识，就必然意味着缺乏意识世界。没有非我，我就不能存在。反过来，非我又依赖于这种存在。使意识存在的世界成为意识的世界。因此，前面引用了萨特的断言：“良心和世界是同一个东西。”

The peasant wished to express the idea that there would be lack­-ing the consciousness of the world which necessarily implies the world of consciousness. I cannot exist without a non-I. In turn, the not-I depends on that existence. The world which brings consciousness into existence becomes the world of that consciousness. Hence, the previously cited affirmation of Sartre: “La conscience et le monde sont donnés d’un même coup.”

当男人和女人同时反思自己和世界时，他们扩大了感知范围，开始将注意力转向以前不显眼的现象：

As women and men, simultaneously reflecting on themselves and on the world, increase the scope of their perception, they begin to direct their observations towards previously inconspicuous phenomena:

在所谓的感知中，即一种明确的意识 [ Gewahren ]，我转向对象，例如纸张。我理解它就是此时此地。这种理解是一种单挑，每个对象都有经验背景。纸张周围放着书籍、铅笔、墨水瓶等等，从某种意义上说，它们也是在“直觉领域”中被感知的；但当我转向纸张时，并没有转向它们，也没有对它们有任何理解，甚至没有从第二意义上理解它们。它们出现了，但没有被单挑出来，没有为自己设定。如果“直觉”已经包括转向的状态，那么对事物的每种感知都有这样一个背景直觉或背景意识区域，这也是一种“有意识的体验”，或者更简单地说确实存在着共同感知的客观背景中的一切的“意识” 。10

In perception properly so-called, as an explicit awareness ­[Gewahren], I am turned towards the object, to the paper, for instance. I apprehend it as being this here and now. The appre­hension is a singling out, every object having a background in experience. Around and about the paper lie books, pencils, ink­well, and so forth, and these in a certain sense are also “per-ceived”, perceptually there, in the “field of intuition”; but whilst I was turned towards the paper there was no turning in their ­direction, nor any apprehending of them, not even in a second-ary sense. They appeared and yet were not singled out, were not posited on their own account. Every perception of a thing has such a zone of background intuitions or background awareness, if “intuiting” already includes the state of being turned towards, and this also is a “conscious experience”, or more briefly a “consciousness of” all indeed that in point of fact lies in the ­co-perceived ­objective background.10

那些客观存在但未被察觉到其深层含义的东西（如果确实被察觉到的话）开始“脱颖而出”，呈现出问题的特征，因此也具有挑战性。因此，男人和女人开始从他们的“背景意识”中挑选出元素并进行反思。这些元素现在是他们考虑的对象，因此也是他们行动和认知的对象。

That which had existed objectively but had not been perceived in its deeper implications (if indeed it was perceived at all) begins to “stand out,” assuming the character of a problem and therefore of challenge. Thus, men and women begin to single out elements from their “background awareness” and to reflect upon them. These elements are now objects of their consideration, and, as such, objects oftheir action and cognition.

在问题提出式教育中，人们发展出批判性地看待自己在这个世界中 存在的方式的能力；他们开始将世界视为一种过程和转变中的现实，而不是一种静态的现实。尽管男女与世界的辩证关系独立于人们如何看待这些关系（或是否被人们看待），但他们采取的行动形式在很大程度上取决于他们如何看待自己在这个世界中。因此，教师-学生和学生-教师同时反思自己和世界，而不会将这种反思与行动二分，从而建立一种真实的思想和行动形式。

In problem-posing education, people develop their power to per-ceive critically the way they exist in the world with which and in which they find themselves; they come to see the world not as a static reality, but as a reality in process, in transformation. Although the dialectical relations of women and men with the world exist ­independently of how these relations are perceived (or whether or not they are perceived at all), it is also true that the form of action they adopt is to a large extent a function of how they perceive themselves in the world. Hence, the teacher-student and the students-teachers reflect simultaneously on themselves and the world ­without dichotomizing this reflection from action, and thus establish an au-thentic form of thought and action.

再次，所分析的两种教育理念和实践发生了冲突。灌输式教育（出于显而易见的原因）试图通过神话化现实来掩盖某些事实，而这些事实解释了人类在世界上的存在方式；问题提出式教育则致力于去神话化。灌输式教育抵制对话；问题提出式教育认为对话对于揭示现实的认知行为是必不可少的。灌输式教育将学生视为帮助对象；问题提出式教育使他们成为批判性思考者。灌输式教育抑制创造力，并通过将意识与意识隔离开来驯化（尽管它不能完全摧毁）意识的意向性。世界，从而剥夺了人们成为更完整的人这一本体论和历史使命。问题提出式教育以创造力为基础，激发对现实的真实反思和行动，从而回应了人作为只有在进行探究和创造性变革时才是真实的存在者的使命。总而言之：银行理论和实践作为束缚和固定的力量，未能承认男人和女人是历史存在者；问题提出式理论和实践以人民的历史性为出发点。

Once again, the two educational concepts and practices under analysis come into conflict. Banking education (for obvious ­reasons) attempts, by mythicizing reality, to conceal certain facts which ex-plain the way human beings exist in the world; problem-posing edu-cation sets itself the task of demythologizing. Banking education resists dialogue; problem-posing education regards dialogue as in-dispensable to the act of cognition which unveils reality. Banking education treats students as objects of assistance; problem-posing education makes them critical thinkers. Banking education inhibits creativity and domesticates (although it cannot completely destroy) the intentionality of consciousness by isolating consciousness from the world, thereby denying people their ontological and historical vocation of becoming more fully human. Problem-posing education bases itself on creativity and stimulates true reflection and action upon reality, thereby responding to the vocation of persons as beings who are authentic only when engaged in inquiry and creative transformation. In sum: banking theory and practice, as immobilizing and fixating forces, fail to acknowledge men and women as historical beings; problem-posing theory and practice take the people’s historicity as their starting point.

问题式教育肯定了男人和女人作为正在成长的生物——作为未完成的、未完成的生物，处于同样未完成的现实之中。事实上，与其他未完成但不是历史的动物相比，人类知道自己是未完成的；他们意识到自己的不完整。这种不完整和这种意识是教育作为人类独有的表现的根源。人类的未完成性和现实的变革性要求教育成为一项持续的活动。

Problem-posing education affirms men and women as beings in the process of becoming—as unfinished, uncompleted beings in and with a likewise unfinished reality. Indeed, in contrast to other animals who are unfinished, but not historical, people know themselves to be unfinished; they are aware of their incompletion. In this incompletion and this awareness lie the very roots of education as an ­exclusively human manifestation. The unfinished character of hu-man beings and the transformational character of reality necessitate that education be an ongoing activity.

因此，教育在实践中不断被重塑。为了存在，它必须成为。它的“持续时间”（在柏格森的意义上）存在于对立的永恒和变化的相互作用中。银行式教育强调永恒，因此变得反动；问题式教育——既不接受“行为良好”的现在，也不接受预先确定的未来——扎根于动态的现在，因此具有革命性。

Education is thus constantly remade in the praxis. In order to be, it must become. Its “duration” (in the Bergsonian meaning of the word) is found in the interplay of the opposites permanence and change. The banking method emphasizes permanence and becomes reactionary; problem-posing education—which accepts neither a “well-behaved” present nor a predetermined future—roots itself in the dynamic present and becomes revolutionary.

问题提出式教育是革命性​​的未来。因此，它是预言性的（因此，也是充满希望的）。因此，它符合人类的历史本质。因此，它肯定了女性和男性是超越自我、向前迈进和展望未来的人，对他们来说，静止不动是一种致命的威胁，对他们来说，回顾过去只能是一种更清楚地了解自己是什么、自己是谁的手段，这样他们才能更明智地建设未来。因此，它认同让人们意识到自己不完整的运动——一场有出发点、有主体、有目标的历史运动。

Problem-posing education is revolutionary futurity. Hence it is prophetic (and, as such, hopeful). Hence, it corresponds to the historical nature of humankind. Hence, it affirms women and men as beings who transcend themselves, who move forward and look ahead, for whom immobility represents a fatal threat, for whom looking at the past must only be a means of understanding more clearly what and who they are so that they can more wisely build the future. Hence, it identifies with the movement which engages people as beings aware of their incompletion—an historical movement which has its point of departure, its Subjects and its objective.

运动的出发点在于人民本身。但是，由于人民不能脱离世界、脱离现实而存在，因此运动必须从人与世界的关系开始。因此，出发点必须始终是“此时此地”的男男女女，这构成了他们所处、从中出现和介入的境况。只有从这种境况出发——这决定了他们对这种境况的看法——他们才能开始行动。要真正做到这一点，他们必须将自己的状态视为不是命中注定和不可改变的，而仅仅是有限的——因此具有挑战性。

The point of departure of the movement lies in the people themselves. But since people do not exist apart from the world, apart from reality, the movement must begin with the human-world relationship. Accordingly, the point of departure must always be with men and women in the “here and now,” which constitutes the situation within which they are submerged, from which they emerge, and in which they intervene. Only by starting from this situation—which determines their perception of it—can they begin to move. To do this authentically they must perceive their state not as fated and unalterable, but merely as limiting—and therefore challenging.

银行法直接或间接地强化了人们对其处境的宿命论认知，而问题提出法则将这种处境本身作为问题呈现给他们。随着处境成为他们认知的对象，产生宿命论的天真或奇幻认知让位于能够像感知现实一样感知自身的认知，因此能够对现实进行批判性客观的认知。

Whereas the banking method directly or indirectly reinforces men’s fatalistic perception of their situation, the problem-posing method presents this very situation to them as a problem. As the situation becomes the object of their cognition, the naïve or magical perception which produced their fatalism gives way to perception which is able to perceive itself even as it perceives reality, and can thus be critically objective about that reality.

人们对自身处境的深刻认识使人们认识到，这种处境是一种易于改变的历史现实。顺从让位于改变和探究的动力，人们觉得自己可以控制这些动力。如果人们作为历史存在，必然与其他人一起参与探究运动，却不控制这一运动，那么这将是（现在也是）对他们人性的侵犯。任何某些人阻止其他人参与探究过程的情况都是暴力行为。使用的方法并不重要；将人类从自己的决策中分离出来就是将他们变成物品。

A deepened consciousness of their situation leads people to ap-prehend that situation as an historical reality susceptible of transfor­mation. Resignation gives way to the drive for transformation and inquiry, over which men feel themselves to be in control. If ­people, as historical beings necessarily engaged with other people in a movement of inquiry, did not control that movement, it would be (and is) a violation of their humanity. Any situation in which some individuals prevent others from engaging in the process of inquiry is one of violence. The means used are not important; to alienate human beings from their own decision-making is to change them into objects.

这一探究运动必须以人性化为目标——这是人民的历史使命。然而，追求充分的人性不能在孤立或个人主义中实现，而只能在友谊和团结中实现；因此，它不能在压迫者和被压迫者之间的对立关系中展开。没有人能在阻止他人成为真正的人的同时成为真正的人。试图变得更人性化、更个人化，会导致更自私地讲，这是一种非人性化。并不是说拥有不是成为人的基本条件。正因为拥有是必要的，所以不能让某些人的拥有成为其他人拥有的障碍，不能巩固前者的权力来压制后者。

This movement of inquiry must be directed towards humanization—the people’s historical vocation. The pursuit of full humanity, however, cannot be carried out in isolation or individualism, but only in fellowship and solidarity; therefore it cannot unfold in the antagonistic relations between oppressors and oppressed. No one can be authentically human while he prevents others from being so. Attempting to be more human, individualistically, leads to ­having more, egotistically, a form of dehumanization. Not that it is not ­fundamental to have in order to be human. Precisely because it is necessary, some men’s having must not be allowed to constitute an obstacle to others’ having, must not consolidate the power of the ­former to crush the latter.

问题提出式教育是一种人文主义和解放实践，它认为受统治的人民必须为自己的解放而斗争，这是根本。为此，它使教师和学生能够通过克服权威主义和异化的知识主义成为教育过程的主体；它还使人们能够克服对现实的错误认识。世界不再是用欺骗性语言来描述的东西，而是成为男人和女人进行变革行动的对象，从而使他们人性化。

Problem-posing education, as a humanist and liberating praxis, posits as fundamental that the people subjected to domination must fight for their emancipation. To that end, it enables teachers and ­students to become Subjects of the educational process by overcoming authoritarianism and an alienating intellectualism; it also enables people to overcome their false perception of reality. The world—no longer something to be described with deceptive words—becomes the object of that transforming action by men and women which results in their humanization.

提出问题的教育不会、也不能服务于压迫者的利益。任何压迫秩序都不能允许被压迫者开始质疑：为什么？虽然只有革命社会才能系统地进行这种教育，但革命领导人无需掌握全部权力就可以采用这种方法。在革命过程中，领导人不能以权宜之计为由将银行制度作为一种临时措施，意图以后以真正的革命方式行事。他们必须从一开始就具有革命性——也就是说，具有对话性。

Problem-posing education does not and cannot serve the interests of the oppressor. No oppressive order could permit the oppressed to begin to question: Why? While only a revolutionary society can carry out this education in systematic terms, the revolutionary leaders need not take full power before they can employ the method. In the revolutionary process, the leaders cannot utilize the banking method as an interim measure, justified on grounds of expediency, with the intention of later behaving in a genuinely revolutionary fashion. They must be revolutionary—that is to say, dialogical—from the outset.

笔记

Notes

1 Simone de Beauvoir，La Pensée de Droite，Aujord'hui（巴黎）； ST，El Pensami-ento politico de la Derecha（布宜诺斯艾利斯，1963 年），第 14 页。 34.

1 Simone de Beauvoir, La Pensée de Droite, Aujord’hui (Paris); ST, El Pensami-ento político de la Derecha (Buenos Aires, 1963), p. 34.

2这一概念与萨特所说的“消化性”或“营养性”教育概念相对应，即知识由教师“喂给”学生，以“充实他们”。参见让-保罗·萨特，《胡塞尔现象学的基本思想：意向性》，《情境》I（巴黎，1947 年）。

2 This concept corresponds to what Sartre calls the “digestive” or “nutritive” ­concept of education, in which knowledge is “fed” by the teacher to the students to “fill them out.” See Jean-Paul Sartre, “Une idée fundamentale de la phénomeno-logie de Husserl: L’intentionalité,” Situations I (Paris. 1947).

3例如，有些教授在阅读书单中指定一本书应该从第 10 页阅读到第 15 页——这样做是为了“帮助”他们的学生！

3 For example, some professors specify in their reading lists that a book should be read from pages 10 to 15—and do this to “help” their students!

4 Fromm，上文引文，第 41 页。

4 Fromm, op. cit., p. 41.

5同上，第 31 页。

5 Ibid., p. 31.

6同上。

6 Ibid.

7莱因霍尔德·尼布尔，《道德的人与不道德的社会》（纽约，1960 年），第 130 页。

7 Reinhold Niebuhr, Moral Man and Immoral Society (New York, 1960), p. 130.

8萨特；上文引文，第 32 页。

8 Sartre; op. cit., p. 32.

9 See chapter 3.—Translator’s note.

10埃德蒙德·胡塞尔，《理念——纯粹现象学导论》（伦敦，1969 年），第 105-106 页。

章

CHAPTER

3

3

当我们试图将对话作为一种人类现象来分析时，我们发现了对话本身的本质：词语。但词语不仅仅是使对话成为可能的工具；因此，我们必须寻找其构成要素。在词语中，我们发现了反思和行动两个维度，它们之间的相互作用如此激烈，以至于如果牺牲其中一个维度——哪怕只是部分牺牲——另一个维度也会立即受到影响。没有一个真正的词语不是实践。1因此 ，说出真正的词语就是改变世界。2

As we attempt to analyze dialogue as a human ­phenomenon, we ­discover something which is the essence of dialogue itself: the word. But the word is more than just an instru­-ment which makes dialogue possible; accordingly, we must seek its constitutive elements. Within the word we find two dimensions, reflection and action, in such radical interaction that if one is sac­rificed—even in part—the other immediately suffers. There is no true word that is not at the same time a praxis.1 Thus, to speak a true word is to transform the world.2

当一个词语的构成要素被强加二分法时，它就变成了一个不真实的词语，一个无法改变现实的词语。当一个词语被剥夺了行动的维度时，反思也会自动受到影响；这个词就变成了闲聊、变成了空话、变成了被异化和疏远的“废话”。它变成了一个空洞的词语，一个无法谴责世界的词语，因为如果没有改变的承诺，谴责就是不可能的，没有行动，就不会有改变。

An unauthentic word, one which is unable to transform reality, results when dichotomy is imposed upon its constitutive elements. When a word is deprived of its dimension of action, reflection automatically suffers as well; and the word is changed into idle chatter, into verbalism, into an alienated and alienating “blah.” It becomes an empty word, one which cannot denounce the world, for denuncia­tion is impossible without a commitment to transform, and there is no transformation without action.

另一方面，如果只强调行动，而忽视反思，那么言语就会变成行动主义。后者——为行动而行动——否定了真正的实践，使对话变得不可能。这两种二分法都会产生不真实的存在形式，从而产生不真实的思想形式，而这又会强化原有的二分法。

On the other hand, if action is emphasized exclusively, to the ­detriment of reflection, the word is converted into activism. The ­latter—action for action’s sake—negates the true praxis and makes dialogue impossible. Either dichotomy, by creating unauthentic forms of existence, creates also unauthentic forms of thought, which reinforce the original dichotomy.

人类的存在不可能是沉默的，也不能被虚假的语言所滋养，而只能被真实的语言所滋养，男男女女用这些语言来改变世界。从人类的角度来看，存在就是命名世界，改变世界。一旦命名，世界反过来又会作为一个问题重新出现在命名者面前，并要求他们重新命名。人类不是在沉默中建立起来的，而是 在语言、工作和行动反思中建立起来的。

Human existence cannot be silent, nor can it be nourished by false words, but only by true words, with which men and women transform the world. To exist, humanly, is to name the world, to change it. Once named, the world in its turn reappears to the nam-ers as a problem and requires of them a new naming. Human beings are not built in silence,3 but in word, in work, in action-reflection.

但是，虽然说出真正的话语（即工作，即实践）就是改变世界，但说出话语并不是少数人的特权，而是每个人的权利。因此，没有人可以独自说出真正的话语，也不能代替他人说出真正的话语，这是一种剥夺他人话语权的规定性行为。

But while to say the true word—which is work, which is praxis—is to transform the world, saying that word is not the privilege of some few persons, but the right of everyone. Consequently, no one can say a true word alone—nor can she say it for another, in a prescriptive act which robs others of their words.

对话是人与人之间的相遇，以世界为媒介，为世界命名。因此，那些想要命名世界的人和那些不希望命名世界的人之间，那些否认他人说话权利的人和那些说话权利被剥夺的人之间，是无法进行对话的。那些被剥夺了说话权利的人必须首先收回这一权利，并防止这种非人道的侵略行为继续下去。

Dialogue is the encounter between men, mediated by the world, in order to name the world. Hence, dialogue cannot occur between those who want to name the world and those who do not wish this naming—between those who deny others the right to speak their word and those whose right to speak has been denied them. Those who have been denied their primordial right to speak their word must first reclaim this right and prevent the continuation of this dehumanizing aggression.

如果人们通过说出自己的话语来命名世界，从而改变世界，那么对话就成为他们作为人类实现意义的方式。因此，对话是一种存在的必需品。由于对话是对话者对世界进行统一的反思和行动的相遇，而世界要加以改造和人性化，这种对话就不能沦为一个人将思想“寄存”给另一个人的行为，也不能成为简单的思想交流，供讨论者“消费”。它也不是那些既不致力于命名世界，也不致力于寻求真理，而是致力于强加自己的真理的人之间的敌对、论战。因为对话是命名世界的男人和女人之间的相遇，所以它绝不能是一些人代表其他人命名的情况。对话是一种创造行为，绝不能成为一个人统治另一个人的狡猾工具。对话中隐含的统治是对话者对世界的统治，对话是为了解放人类而征服世界。

If it is in speaking their word that people, by naming the world, transform it, dialogue imposes itself as the way by which they achieve significance as human beings. Dialogue is thus an existential necessity. And since dialogue is the encounter in which the united reflection and action of the dialoguers are addressed to the world which is to be transformed and humanized, this dialogue cannot be re-duced to the act of one person’s “depositing” ideas in another, nor canit become a simple exchange of ideas to be “consumed” by the discussants. Nor yet is it a hostile, polemical argument between those who are committed neither to the naming of the world, nor to the search for truth, but rather to the imposition of their own truth. Because dialogue is an encounter among women and men who name the world, it must not be a situation where some name on behalf of others. It is an act of creation; it must not serve as a crafty instrument for the domination of one person by another. The ­domination implicit in dialogue is that of the world by the dia-loguers; it is conquest of the world for the liberation of humankind.

然而，如果没有对世界和人民的深厚爱，对话就不可能存在。命名世界是一种创造和再创造的行为，如果没有爱，就不可能实现。4爱既是对话的基础，也是对话本身。因此，它必然是负责任 的主体的任务，不能存在于统治关系中。统治揭示了爱的病态：统治者是虐待狂，被统治者是受虐狂。因为爱是一种勇敢的行为，而不是恐惧的行为，所以爱是对他人的承诺。无论被压迫者在哪里，爱的行为都是对他们事业——解放事业的承诺。而这种承诺，因为它是爱，是具有对话性的。作为一种行为，爱是一种勇敢的行为，而不是恐惧的行为。作为勇敢的象征，爱不能是多愁善感的；作为自由的行为，爱不能成为操纵的借口。它必须产生其他自由行为；否则，它就不是爱。只有消除压迫的局面，才有可能恢复被压迫的局面所扼杀的爱。如果我不爱世界——如果我不爱生命——如果我不爱人们——我就无法进行对话。

Dialogue cannot exist, however, in the absence of a profound love for the world and for people. The naming of the world, which is an act of creation and re-creation, is not possible if it is not infused with love.4 Love is at the same time the foundation of dialogue and dialogue itself. It is thus necessarily the task of responsible Subjects and cannot exist in a relation of domination. Domination reveals the pathology of love: sadism in the dominator and masochism in the dominated. Because love is an act of courage, not of fear, love is ­commitment to others. No matter where the oppressed are found, the act of love is commitment to their cause—the cause of liberation. And this commitment, because it is loving, is dialogical. As an act of bravery, love cannot be sentimental; as an act of freedom, it must not serve as a pretext for manipulation. It must generate other acts of freedom; otherwise, it is not love. Only by abolishing the situation of oppression is it possible to restore the love which that situation made impossible. If I do not love the world—if I do not love life—if I do not love people—I cannot enter into dialogue.

另一方面，对话离不开谦卑。命名世界，人们通过命名不断重塑世界，这不能是一种傲慢的行为。对话是人们为了共同的学习和行动而进行的相遇，如果双方（或其中一方）缺乏谦卑，对话就会破裂。如果我总是把无知投射到别人身上，而从不察觉自己的无知，我怎么能对话呢？如果我把自己视为与他人不同的个体——仅仅是“它”，我无法从中认出其他“我”，我怎么能对话呢？如果我认为自己是“纯粹”人的小团体中的一员，是真理和知识的拥有者，而对他们来说，所有非成员都是“这些人”或“普通人”，我怎么能对话呢？如果我从命名世界是精英的任务，而人民在历史中的存在是衰落的标志，因此应该避免，我怎么能对话呢？如果我对其他人的贡献持封闭甚至冒犯态度，我怎么能对话呢？如果我害怕被取代，那我怎么能对话呢？仅仅是这种可能性就让我痛苦不堪、软弱无力。自给自足与对话是不相容的。缺乏谦逊（或已经丧失谦逊）的男人和女人无法接近人民，无法成为人民命名世界的伙伴。一个不能承认自己和其他人一样凡人的人，在达到相遇的点之前还有很长的路要走。在相遇的点上，既没有完全无知的人，也没有完美的圣人；只有那些一起努力学习比现在更多知识的人。

On the other hand, dialogue cannot exist without humility. The naming of the world, through which people constantly re-create that world, cannot be an act of arrogance. Dialogue, as the encounter of those addressed to the common t ask of learning and acting, is broken if the parties (or one of them) lack humility. How can I dialogue if I always project ignorance onto others and never perceive my own? How can I dialogue if I regard myself as a case apart from ­others—mere “its” in whom I cannot recognize other “I”s? How can I dialogue if I consider myself a member of the in-group of “pure” men, the owners of truth and knowledge, for whom all non-­members are “these people” or “the great unwashed”? How can I dialogue if I start from the premise that naming the world is the task of an elite and that the presence of the people in history is a sign of deterioration, thus to be avoided? How can I dialogue if I am closed to—and even offended by—the contribution of others? How can I dialogue if I am afraid of being displaced, the mere possibility causing me ­torment and weakness? Self-sufficiency is incompatible with dialogue. Men and women who lack humility (or have lost it) cannot come to the people, cannot be their partners in naming the world. Someone who cannot acknowledge himself to be as mortal as every­one else still has a long way to go before he can reach the point of encounter. At the point of encounter there are neither utter ignoramuses nor perfect sages; there are only people who are attempting, together, to learn more than they now know.

对话还需要对人类有强烈的信心，相信人类有能力创造和重塑、创造和再创造，相信人类的使命是成为更完整的人（这不是精英的特权，而是所有人与生俱来的权利）。对人的信心是对话的先验要求；“对话者”相信他人甚至在他与人民面对面接触之前，他就已经对人民产生了信任。然而，他的信念并不天真。“对话人”是批判性的，他知道，尽管人类有能力创造和改变，但在具体的异化情况下，个人在使用这种力量时可能会受到损害。然而，这种可能性并没有摧毁他对人民的信念，反而让他觉得这是一个必须应对的挑战。他坚信，创造和改变的力量，即使在具体情况下受到挫败，也往往会重生。而且这种重生可以发生——不是无缘无故的，而是在解放斗争中发生的——通过解放劳动取代奴隶劳动，解放劳动赋予了生活以活力。没有这种对人民的信念，对话就是一场闹剧，不可避免地会沦为家长式的操纵。

Dialogue further requires an intense faith in humankind, faith in their power to make and remake, to create and re-create, faith in their vocation to be more fully human (which is not the privilege of an elite, but the birthright of all). Faith in people is an a priori ­requirement for dialogue; the “dialogical man” believes in ­others even before he meets them face to face. His faith, however, is not naïve. The “dialogical man” is critical and knows that although it is within the power of humans to create and transform, in a ­concrete situation of alienation individuals may be impaired in the use of that power. Far from destroying his faith in the people, however, this possibility strikes him as a challenge to which he must respond. He is convinced that the power to create and transform, even when thwarted in concrete situations, tends to be reborn. And that rebirth can occur—not gratuitously, but in and through the struggle for ­liberation—in the supersedence of slave labor by emancipated labor which gives zest to life. Without this faith in people, dialogue is a farce which inevitably degenerates into paternalistic manipulation.

对话建立在爱、谦卑和信仰的基础上，成为一种水平关系，对话者之间的相互信任是其合乎逻辑的结果。如果充满爱、谦卑和信仰的对话没有产生这种相互信任的气氛，从而导致对话者在命名世界方面建立更紧密的伙伴关系，那将是自相矛盾的。相反，在反对话的灌输式教育方法中，这种信任显然是不存在的。对人类的信任是对话的先验要求，而信任则是由对话建立起来的。如果对话失败了，就会发现缺乏先决条件。虚假的爱、虚假的谦卑和对他人的微弱信任不能产生信任。信任取决于一方向另一方提供其真实、具体意图的证据；如果该方的言行不一致，信任就不可能存在。说一套做一套——轻视自己的诺言——不能激发信任。美化民主而压制人民是一出闹剧；讲人道主义而否定人，这是谎言。

Founding itself upon love, humility, and faith, dialogue becomes a horizontal relationship of which mutual trust between the dia­loguers is the logical consequence. It would be a contradiction in terms if dialogue—loving, humble, and full of faith—did not produce this climate of mutual trust, which leads the dialoguers into ever closer partnership in the naming of the world. Conversely, such trust is obviously absent in the anti-dialogics of the banking method of education. Whereas faith in humankind is an a priori requirement for dialogue, trust is established by dialogue. Should it founder, it will be seen that the preconditions were lacking. False love, false humility, and feeble faith in others cannot create trust. Trust is ­contingent on the evidence which one party provides the others of his true, concrete intentions; it cannot exist if that party’s words do not coincide with their actions. To say one thing and do another—to take one’s own word lightly—cannot inspire trust. To glorify democracy and to silence the people is a farce; to discourse on humanism and to negate people is a lie.

没有希望，对话也无法存在。希望根植于人类的不完整，人们不断从这种不完整中寻找出路——这种寻找只能在与他人交流中才能进行。绝望是一种沉默，一种否定世界和逃避世界的形式。不公正秩序造成的非人性化不是绝望的原因，而是希望的原因，它导致人们不断追求不公正剥夺了人性。然而，希望并不在于双手抱臂等待。只要我战斗，我就会受到希望的推动；如果我怀着希望战斗，那么我就可以等待。作为寻求更人性化的女性和男性之间的相遇，对话无法在绝望的气氛中进行。如果对话者期望他们的努力不会有任何结果，他们的相遇将是空洞而乏味的、官僚主义的和乏味的。

Nor yet can dialogue exist without hope. Hope is rooted in men’s incompletion, from which they move out in constant search—a search which can be carried out only in communion with others. Hopelessness is a form of silence, of denying the world and fleeing from it. The dehumanization resulting from an unjust order is not a cause for despair but for hope, leading to the incessant pursuit of the humanity denied by injustice. Hope, however, does not consist in crossing one’s arms and waiting. As long as I fight, I am moved by hope; and if I fight with hope, then I can wait. As the encounter of women and men seeking to be more fully human, dialogue cannot be carried on in a climate of hopelessness. If the dialoguers expect nothing to come of their efforts, their encounter will be empty and sterile, bureaucratic and tedious.

最后，真正的对话不可能存在，除非对话者进行批判性思考——这种思考能辨别出世界与人民之间不可分割的团结，不允许两者之间有任何二分法——这种思考将现实视为过程、转变，而不是静态实体——这种思考不会将自己与行动分开，而是不断沉浸在时间性中，而不担心其中的风险。批判性思考与天真的思考形成对比，天真的思考将“历史时间视为一种重量，一种过去收获和经验的分层”，5 现在应该从中正常化和“表现良好”。对于天真的思想家来说，重要的是适应这种正常化的“今天”。对于批评家来说，重要的是不断改造现实，以继续使人人性化。用皮埃尔·富特的话来说：

Finally, true dialogue cannot exist unless the dialoguers engage in critical thinking—thinking which discerns an indivisible ­solidarity between the world and the people and admits of no dichotomy between them—thinking which perceives reality as process, as ­transformation, rather than as a static entity—thinking which does not separate itself from action, but constantly immerses itself in ­temporality without fear of the risks involved. Critical thinking contrasts with naive thinking, which sees “historical time as a weight, a stratification of the acquisitions and experiences of the past,”5 from which the present should emerge normalized and “well-behaved.” For the naive thinker, the important thing is accommodation to this ­normalized “today.” For the critic, the important thing is the continuing transformation of reality, in behalf of the continuing hu-manization of men. In the words of Pierre Furter:

我们的目标不再是通过抓住有保障的空间来消除时间性的风险，而是将空间时间化……宇宙展现给我的不是空间，不是强加给我的庞大存在，我只能适应它，而是一个范围，一个随着我对其采取行动而成形的领域。6

The goal will no longer be to eliminate the risks of ­temporality by clutching to guaranteed space, but rather to temporalize space . . . The universe is revealed to me not as space, imposing a massive presence to which I can but adapt, but as a scope, a domain which takes shape as I act upon it.6

对于天真的思想来说，目标恰恰是坚守这个有保障的空间并适应它。通过否定时间性，它也就否定了自己。

For naïve thinking, the goal is precisely to hold fast to this guaranteed space and adjust to it. By thus denying temporality, it denies itself as well.

只有对话才能产生批判性思维，而对话需要批判性思维。没有对话就没有交流交流是教育的本质，没有交流就没有真正的教育。能够解决师生矛盾的教育，是在双方都将自己的认知行为指向他们所中介的对象的情况下进行的。因此，作为自由实践的教育的对话性，并非始于师生在教学情境中与师生相遇，而是始于师生首先问自己将与师生对话什么。对对话内容的关注，实际上是对教育项目内容的关注。

Only dialogue, which requires critical thinking, is also capable of generating critical thinking. Without dialogue there is no communication, and without communication there can be no true education. Education which is able to resolve the contradiction between teacher and student takes place in a situation in which both address their act of cognition to the object by which they are mediated. Thus, the dialogical character of education as the practice of freedom does not begin when the teacher-student meets with the students-teachers in a pedagogical situation, but rather when the former first asks herself or himself what she or he will dialogue with the latter about. And preoccupation with the content of dialogue is really ­preoccupation with the program content of education.

对于反对话灌输式教育者来说，内容问题仅仅涉及他将向学生讲述的课程；他通过组织自己的课程来回答自己的问题。对于对话式、提出问题的师生来说，教育的课程内容既不是礼物也不是强加的东西——要存入学生的零碎信息——而是有组织的、系统化的、发展的“再现”，向个人展示他们想要了解更多的东西。7

For the anti-dialogical banking educator, the question of content simply concerns the program about which he will discourse to his students; and he answers his own question, by organizing his own program. For the dialogical, problem-posing teacher-student, the program content of education is neither a gift nor an imposition—bits of i nformation to be deposited in the students—but rather the organized, systematized, and developed “re-presentation” to indi­viduals of the things about which they want to know more.7

真正的教育不是通过“A”为“B”或“A”关于“B”来进行的，而是通过“A”与“B”进行，以世界为媒介——这个世界给双方留下深刻印象并带来挑战，从而产生关于它的观点或意见。这些观点充满了焦虑、怀疑、希望或绝望，暗示着重要的主题，教育的课程内容可以在此基础上建立。天真的人文主义想要创造一个“好人”的理想模式，因此常常忽视现实人的具体、存在的现状。用皮埃尔·富特的话来说，真正的人文主义“在于允许我们充分的人性的意识作为一种条件和义务、作为一种情况出现8 我们根本不能像银行那样，直接向劳动者（城市或农民）9 传授“知识”，或将我们自己组织的内容计划中包含的“好人”模式强加给他们。许多政治和教育计划都失败了，因为它们的作者根据自己对现实的个人看法来设计它们，从来没有考虑过（除了作为他们行动的对象）他们的计划表面上针对的处于某种境况中的人。

Authentic education is not carried on by “A” for “B” or by “A” about “B,” but rather by “A” with “B,” mediated by the world—a world which impresses and challenges both parties, giving rise to views or opinions about it. These views, impregnated with ­anxieties, doubts, hopes, or hopelessness, imply significant themes on the basis of which the program content of education can be built. In its desire to create an ideal model of the “good man,” a naïvely con-ceived humanism often overlooks the concrete, existential, present situation of real people. Authentic humanism, in Pierre Furter’s words, “consists in permitting the emergence of the awareness of our full humanity, as a condition and as an obligation, as a ­situation and as a project.”8 We simply cannot go to the laborers—urban or peasant9 —in the banking style, to give them “knowledge” or to im-pose upon them the model of the “good man” contained in a program whose content we have ourselves organized. Many political and educational plans have failed because their authors designed them according to their own personal views of reality, never once taking into account (except as mere objects of their actions) the men-in-a-situation to whom their program was ostensibly directed.

对于真正的人文主义教育家和真正的革命者来说，行动的目标是他们与其他人共同改变的现实——而不是其他人自己。压迫者是那些对人民采取行动，向他们灌输思想，使他们适应必须保持不变的现实的人。然而不幸的是，革命领袖们为了获得人民对革命行动的支持，往往陷入了自上而下的计划内容的灌输路线。他们向农民或城市群众提出的项目可能符合他们自己的世界观，但不符合人民的世界观。10他们忘记了他们的基本目标是 战斗革命者应该与人民站在一起，为人民夺回被夺走的人性，而不是“争取人民”到他们一边。这句话不属于革命领袖的词汇，而是属于压迫者的词汇。革命者的角色是与人民一起解放人民，并被解放，而不是争取人民。

For the truly humanist educator and the authentic ­revolutionary, the object of action is the reality to be transformed by them together with other people—not other men and women themselves. The oppressors are the ones who act upon the people to indoctrinate them and adjust them to a reality which must remain untouched. Unfortunately, however, in their desire to obtain the support of the people for revolutionary action, revolutionary leaders often fall for the banking line of planning program content from the top down.
