They approach the peasant or urban masses with projects which may correspond to their own view of the world, but not to that of the people.10 They forget that their fundamental objective is to fight alongside the people for the recovery of the people’s stolen humanity, not to “win the people over” to their side. Such a phrase does not belong in the vocabulary of revolutionary leaders, but in that of the oppressor. The revolutionary’s role is to liberate, and be liber-ated, with the people—not to win them over.

在政治活动中，统治精英利用灌输概念来鼓励被压迫者采取被动态度，以适应后者“沉浸”的意识状态，并利用这种被动性用口号“填充”这种意识，从而制造出更多对自由的恐惧。这种做法与真正解放的行动方针是不相容的，这种行动方针通过将压迫者的口号视为问题，帮助被压迫者从自己内心“驱逐”这些口号。毕竟，人文主义者的任务肯定不是把自己的口号与压迫者的口号对立起来，以被压迫者为试验场，先“容纳”一个群体的口号，然后再“容纳”另一个群体的口号。相反，人文主义者的任务是让被压迫者意识到这样一个事实：作为双重存在，在自己内心“容纳”压迫者，他们不可能是真正的人。

In their political activity, the dominant elites utilize the banking concept to encourage passivity in the oppressed, corresponding with the latter’s “submerged” state of consciousness, and take advantage of that passivity to “fill” that consciousness with slogans which create even more fear of freedom. This practice is incompatible with a truly liberating course of action, which, by presenting the oppres­-sors’ slogans as a problem, helps the oppressed to “eject” those ­slogans from within themselves. After all, the task of the ­humanists is surely not that of pitting their slogans against the slogans of the oppressors, with the oppressed as the testing ground, “housing” the slogans of first one group and then the other. On the contrary, the task of the humanists is to see that the oppressed become aware of the fact that as dual beings, “housing” the oppressors within themselves, they cannot be truly human.

这项任务意味着革命领袖们并不是要向人民传达“救赎”的信息，而是要通过与人民对话，了解他们的客观处境和对这种处境的认识——他们对自己以及他们所处和所处的世界的不同认识。如果教育或政治行动计划不尊重人民所持有的特定世界观，就不能指望它会产生积极的结果。这样的计划构成了文化入侵，尽管意图良好

This task implies that revolutionary leaders do not go to the people in order to bring them a message of “salvation,” but in order to come to know through dialogue with them both their objective situ­ation and their awareness of that situation—the various levels of perception of themselves and of the world in which and with which they exist. One cannot expect positive results from an educational or political action program which fails to respect the particular view of the world held by the people. Such a program constitutes cultural invasion,11 good intentions notwithstanding.

组织教育或政治行动的纲领内容的出发点必须是反映人民愿望的、现实存在的、具体的现状。我们必须利用某些基本矛盾，把这种现实存在的、具体的现状作为一个问题摆在人民面前，这个问题是对人民的挑战，要求人民回应——不只是在知识层面，而且在行动层面。12

The starting point for organizing the program content of ­education or political action must be the present, existential, concrete situ­-ation, reflecting the aspirations of the people. Utilizing certain basic contradictions, we must pose this existential, concrete, present situation to the people as a problem which challenges them and requires a response—not just at the intellectual level, but at the level of action.12

我们绝不能仅仅谈论当前形势，绝不能向人们提供与他们自己的关注、怀疑、希望和恐惧几乎没有关系的计划——这些计划有时实际上会增加被压迫意识的恐惧。我们的职责不是向人们讲述我们自己的世界观，也不是试图将这种观点强加给他们，而是与人们就他们的观点和我们的观点进行对话。我们必须认识到，他们的世界观以各种方式体现在他们的行动中，反映了他们在世界上的处境。没有批判性地意识到这种情况的教育和政治行动要么面临“银行化”的风险，要么面临在沙漠中布道的风险。

We must never merely discourse on the present situation, must never provide the people with programs which have little or ­nothing to do with their own preoccupations, doubts, hopes, and fears—programs which at times in fact increase the fears of the oppressed consciousness. It is not our role to speak to the people about our own view of the world, nor to attempt to impose that view on them, but rather to dialogue with the people about their view and ours. We must realize that their view of the world, manifested variously in their action, reflects their situation in the world. Educational and political action which is not critically aware of this situation runs the risk either of “banking” or of preaching in the desert.

教育者和政治家经常说一些话，但人们听不懂，因为他们的语言不符合他们所针对的人的具体情况。因此，他们的谈话只是疏远和异化的修辞。教育者或政治家的语言（越来越明显的是，后者也必须成为教育者，从最广泛的意义上来说），就像人民的语言一样，没有思想就无法存在；语言和思想都离不开它们所指的结构。为了有效地沟通，教育者和政治家必须了解人民的思想和语言辩证构成的结构条件。

Often, educators and politicians speak and are not understood because their language is not attuned to the concrete situation of the people they address. Accordingly, their talk is just alienated and alienating rhetoric. The language of the educator or the politician (and it seems more and more clear that the latter must also become an educator, in the broadest sense of the word), like the language of the people, cannot exist without thought; and neither language nor thought can exist without a structure to which they refer. In order to communicate effectively, educator and politician must understand the structural conditions in which the thought and language of the people are dialectically framed.

我们必须去寻找教育的纲领内容，去寻找那些影响人们的现实，以及教育者和人们对这种现实的认识。对我所说的人民的“主题世界” 13—— 他们的“生成主题”的复合体——的调查开启了教育作为自由实践的对话。这种调查的方法也必须是对话性的，既要提供发现的机会，又要提供发现的机会。生成主题，并激发人们对这些主题的认识。与对话教育的解放目的一致，研究的对象不是人（好像他们是解剖碎片），而是男人和女人用来指代现实的思维语言、他们感知现实的水平以及他们对世界的看法，他们的生成主题就存在于其中。

It is to the reality which mediates men, and to the perception of that reality held by educators and people, that we must go to find the program content of education. The investigation of what I have termed the people’s “thematic universe”13 —the complex of their “generative themes”—inaugurates the dialogue of education as the practice of freedom. The methodology of that investigation must likewise be dialogical, affording the opportunity both to discover generative themes and to stimulate people’s awareness in regard to these themes. Consistent with the liberating purpose of dialogical education, the object of the investigation is not persons (as if they were anatomical fragments), but rather the thought-language with which men and women refer to reality, the levels at which they ­perceive that reality, and their view of the world, in which their ­generative themes are found.

在更精确地描述“生成主题”之前，我认为有必要提出一些初步思考，这也将阐明“最小主题世界”的含义。生成主题的概念既不是任意发明的，也不是需要证明的工作假设。如果它是一个需要证明的假设，那么最初的调查将不是试图确定主题的性质，而是主题本身的存在或不存在。在这种情况下，在试图理解主题的丰富性、重要性、多元性、变革性和历史构成之前，我们必须首先验证它是否是客观事实；只有这样我们才能继续理解它。虽然批判性怀疑的态度是合理的，但似乎确实有可能验证生成主题的真实性——不仅通过一个人自己的存在经验，而且通过对人与世界的关系以及人与世界的关系的批判性反思。

Before describing a “generative theme” more precisely, which will also clarify what is meant by a “minimum thematic universe,” it seems to me indispensable to present a few preliminary reflections. The concept of a generative theme is neither an arbitrary ­invention nor a working hypothesis to be proved. If it were a hypothesis to be proved, the initial investigation would seek not to ascertain the na-ture of the theme, but rather the very existence or non-existence of themes themselves. In that event, before attempting to understand the theme in its richness, its significance, its plurality, its transformations, and its historical composition, we would first have to verify whether or not it is an objective fact; only then could we proceed to apprehend it. Although an attitude of critical doubt is ­legitimate, it does appear possible to verify the reality of the generative theme—not only through one’s own existential experience, but also through critical reflection on the human-world relationship and on the relationships between people implicit in the former.

这一点值得更多关注。人们可能还记得——尽管这似乎有些陈词滥调——在未完成的存在中，只有人不仅将自己的行为而且将自己的自我视为反思的对象；这种能力使人有别于动物，动物无法将自己与活动分开，因此无法反思活动。这种看似肤浅的区别就在于界定了每个人在其生活空间中的行动。由于动物的活动是自身的延伸，因此活动的结果也与自身密不可分：动物既不能设定目标，也不能为它们对自然的改造注入任何超越自身的意义。此外，进行这种活动的“决定”不属于它们，而属于它们的物种。因此，动物从根本上说是“自在的存在”。

This point deserves more attention. One may well remember—trite as it seems—that, of the uncompleted beings, man is the only one to treat not only his actions but his very self as the object of his reflection; this capacity distinguishes him from the animals, which are unable to separate themselves from their activity and thus are unable to reflect upon it. In this apparently superficial distinction lie the boundaries which delimit the action of each in his life space. Because the animals’ activity is an extension of themselves, the re-sults of that activity are also inseparable from themselves: animals can neither set objectives nor infuse their transformation of nature with any significance beyond itself. Moreover, the “decision” to perform this activity belongs not to them but to their species. Animals are, accordingly, fundamentally “beings in themselves.”

动物无法为自己做决定，无法将自己或自己的活动客观化，缺乏自己设定的目标，生活在一个它们无法赋予意义的世界中，由于存在于压倒性的现在，所以没有“明天”和“今天”，动物是非历史的。它们的非历史生活并不发生在严格意义上的“世界”中；对于动物来说，世界并不构成一个可以将其与“我”区分开来的“非我”。人类世界是历史性的，仅仅是“自在存在”的支柱。动物不会受到它们所面临的环境的挑战；它们只是受到刺激。它们的生活不是冒险的生活，因为它们没有意识到冒险。风险不是经过深思熟虑后察觉到的挑战，而只是通过指示它们的迹象“注意到”的；因此，它们不需要决策反应。

Unable to decide for themselves, unable to objectify either themselves or their activity, lacking objectives which they themselves have set, living “submerged” in a world to which they can give no meaning, lacking a “tomorrow” and a “today” because they exist in an overwhelming present, animals are ahistorical. Their ahistorical life does not occur in the “world,” taken in its strict meaning; for the animal, the world does not constitute a “not-I” which could set him apart as an “I.” The human world, which is historical, serves as a mere prop for the “being in itself.” Animals are not challenged by the configuration which confronts them; they are merely stimulated. Their life is not one of risk-taking, for they are not aware of taking risks. Risks are not challenges perceived upon reflection, but merely “noted” by the signs which indicate them; they accordingly do not require decision-making responses.

因此，动物无法承担责任。它们的非历史状态不允许它们“承担”生命。因为它们不“承担”，所以它们无法构建生命；如果它们不构建生命，它们就无法改变生命的结构。它们也无法知道自己会被生命毁灭，因为它们无法将其“支柱”世界扩展为一个有意义的、象征性的世界，其中包括文化和历史。因此，动物不会为了将自己动物化而“动物化”自己的结构——也不会“非动物化”自己。即使在森林里，它们仍然是“自在的存在”，在那里和在动物园里一样像动物。

Consequently, animals cannot commit themselves. Their ahis­torical condition does not permit them to “take on” life. Because they do not “take it on,” they cannot construct it; and if they do not construct it, they cannot transform its configuration. Nor can they know themselves to be destroyed by life, for they cannot expand their “prop” world into a meaningful, symbolic world which includes culture and history. As a result, animals do not “animalize” their ­configuration in order to animalize themselves—nor do they “de-animalize” themselves. Even in the forest, they remain “beings-in-themselves,” as animal-like there as in the zoo.

相反，人——意识到自己的活动和所处的世界，按照自己提出的目标行事，将自己的决定置于自己以及与世界和他人的关系中，通过对世界的改造，将自己的创造性存在注入世界——与动物不同，他们不仅生活，而且存在；14 他们的存在是历史性的。动物在一个非时间的、扁平的、统一的“支柱”上度过一生；人类存在于他们所处的世界中不断地再创造、改造。对动物而言，“这里”仅仅是它们接触到的栖息地；对人来说，“这里”不仅是一个物理空间，更是一个历史空间。

In contrast, the people—aware of their activity and the world in which they are situated, acting in function of the objectives which they propose, having the seat of their decisions located in themselves and in their relations with the world and with others, infusing the world with their creative presence by means of the transformation they effect upon it—unlike animals, not only live but exist;14 and their existence is historical. Animals live out their lives on an atemp­oral, flat, uniform “prop”; humans exist in a world which they are constantly re-creating and transforming. For animals, “here” is only a habitat with which they enter into contact; for people, “here” ­signifies not merely a physical space, but also an historic al space.

严格地说，对于动物来说，“这里”、“现在”、“那里”、“明天”和“昨天”并不存在，动物的生命没有自我意识，是完全被决定的。动物无法超越“这里”、“现在”或“那里”所施加的限制。

Strictly speaking, “here,” “now,” “there,” “tomorrow,” and “yesterday” do not exist for the animal, whose life, lacking self-consciousness, is totally determined. Animals cannot surmount the limits imposed by the “here,” the “now,” or the “there.”

然而，人类因为意识到自己，从而意识到世界——因为他们是有意识的存在——存在于限制的确定和他们自己的自由之间的辩证关系中。当他们将自己与他们所客观化的世界分开时，当他们将自己与他们自己的活动分开时，当他们将自己的决定置于自己身上以及他们与世界和他人的关系中时，人们克服了限制他们的处境：“限制处境”。15这些 情况曾经被个人视为束缚，视为他们解放的障碍，但它们却从背景中脱颖而出，揭示了它们作为既定现实的具体历史维度的真实性质。男人和女人用维埃拉·平托称之为“限制行为”的行动来应对挑战：这些行动旨在否定和克服“既定事实”，而不是被动地接受“既定事实”。

Humans, however, because they are aware of themselves and thus of the world—because they are conscious beings—exist in a dialectical relationship between the determination of limits and their own freedom. As they separate themselves from the world, which they objectify, as they separate themselves from their own activity, as they locate the seat of their decisions in themselves and in their relations with the world and others, people overcome the situations which limit them: the “limit-situations.”15 Once perceived by individuals as fetters, as obstacles to their liberation, these situations stand out in relief from the background, revealing their true nature as concrete historical dimensions of a given reality. Men and women respond to the challenge with actions which Vieira Pinto calls “limit-acts”: those directed at negating and overcoming, rather than passively ac-cepting, the “given.”

因此，造成绝望气氛的并不是这些限制性情况本身，而是在特定历史时刻，女性和男性如何看待这些限制性情况：它们是束缚还是不可逾越的障碍。随着批判性认识在行动中体现，一种充满希望和信心的气氛逐渐形成，引导男性试图克服这些限制性情况。这一目标只有通过采取行动才能实现。crete，历史现实，其中存在着历史性的极限情况。随着现实的转变和这些情况的取代，新的情况将会出现，而新的情况又将引发新的极限行为。

Thus, it is not the limit-situations in and of themselves which ­create a climate of hopelessness, but rather how they are perceived by women and men at a given historical moment: whether they appear as fetters or as insurmountable barriers. As critical percep-tion is embodied in action, a climate of hope and confidence devel-ops which leads men to attempt to overcome the limit-situations. This objective can be achieved only through action upon the concrete, historical reality in which limit-situations historically are found. As reality is transformed and these situations are superseded, new ones will appear, which in turn will evoke new limit-acts.

由于其非历史性，动物的支柱世界不包含任何极限情况。同样，动物缺乏行使极限行为的能力，而极限行为需要对世界采取果断的态度：与世界分离并客观化世界以改变世界。动物与它们的支柱有机地联系在一起，不会区分自己和世界。因此，动物不受历史性的极限情况的限制，而是受整个支柱的限制。动物的适当角色不是与它们的支柱相关（在这种情况下，支柱将是一个世界），而是适应它。因此，当动物“生产”巢穴、蜂巢或洞穴时，它们并不是在创造由“极限行为”即转化反应产生的产品。它们的生产活动服从于满足身体需求，这种需求只是刺激而不是挑战。“动物的产品直接属于其身体，而人类则自由地面对其产品。” 16

The prop world of animals contains no limit-situations, due to its ahistorical character. Similarly, animals lack the ability to exercise limit-acts, which require a decisive attitude towards the world: separation from and objectification of the world in order to transform it. Organically bound to their prop, animals do not distinguish between themselves and the world. Accordingly, animals are not limited by limit-situations—which are historical—but rather by the entire prop. And the appropriate role for animals is not to relate to their prop (in that event, the prop would be a world), but to adapt to it. Thus, when animals “produce” a nest, a hive, or a burrow, they are not creating products which result from “limit-acts,” that is, transforming responses. Their productive activity is subordinated to the satisfaction of a physical necessity which is simply stimulating, rather than challenging. “An animal’s product belongs immediately to its physical body, whilst man freely confronts his product.”16

只有那些由存在活动产生但不属于其物理身体的产品（尽管这些产品可能带有其印记）才能赋予语境意义，从而成为一个世界。一个能够进行这种生产的存在（因此必然意识到自己，是“为自己而存在”）如果他或她没有处于他或她与之相关的世界中，就不再存在；就像如果这个存在不存在，世界就不再存在一样。

Only products which result from the activity of a being but do not belong to its physical body (though these products may bear its seal), can give a dimension of meaning to the context, which thus becomes a world. A being capable of such production (who thereby is necessarily aware of himself, is a “being for himself”) could no longer be if she or he were not in the process of being in the world with which he or she relates; just as the world would no longer exist if this being did not exist.

动物（因为它们的活动不构成限制行为）不能创造脱离自身的产品，而人类（通过对世界的行动创造了文化和历史领域）之间的区别在于，只有后者才是实践的存在者。只有人类才是实践，而实践作为真正改造现实的反思和行动，才是实践。知识和创造的源泉。动物的活动没有实践，所以不具有创造性；人的改造活动才具有创造性。

The difference between animals—who (because their activity does not constitute limit-acts) cannot create products detached from themselves—and humankind—who through their action upon the world create the realm of culture and history—is that only the latter are beings of the praxis. Only human beings are praxis—the praxis which, as the reflection and action which truly transform reality, is the source of knowledge and creation. Animal activity, which occurs without a praxis, is not creative; people’s transforming activity is.

人类是变革和创造的存在，在与现实的永久关系中，人类不仅生产物质产品（有形物体），而且还生产社会制度、思想和概念。17通过 不断的实践，男人和女人同时创造了历史并成为历史社会的存在。因为与动物不同，人类可以将时间三维化为过去、现在和未来，所以他们的历史在他们自己的创造中发展为一个不断转变的过程，时代单位在其中实现。这些时代单位不是封闭的时间段，也不是人们被限制在其中的静态隔间。如果是这样的话，历史的一个基本条件——它的连续性——就会消失。相反，时代单位在历史连续性的动态中相互关联。18

It is as transforming and creative beings that humans, in their permanent relations with reality, produce not only material goods—tangible objects—but also social institutions, ideas, and concepts.17 Through their continuing praxis, men and women simultaneously create history and become historical-social beings. Because—in contrast to animals—people can tri-dimensionalize time into the past, the present, and the future, their history, in function of their own creations, develops as a constant process of transformation within which epochal units materialize. These epochal units are not closed periods of time, static compartments within which people are confined. Were this the case, a fundamental condition of history—its continuity—would disappear. On the contrary, epochal units interrelate in the dynamics of historical continuity.18

一个时代的特点是，各种思想、观念、希望、疑虑、价值观和挑战与其对立面辩证地相互作用，力求达到圆满。这些思想、价值观、观念和希望的具体表现，以及阻碍人民充分人性的障碍，构成了该时代的主题。这些主题暗示着其他对立甚至对立的主题；它们还表明要执行和完成的任务。因此，历史主题从来不是孤立的、独立的、不连贯的或静止的；它们总是与对立面辩证地相互作用。这些主题也只能在人与世界的关系中找到。一个时代相互作用的主题的复合体构成了它的“主题世界”。

An epoch is characterized by a complex of ideas, concepts, hopes, doubts, values, and challenges in dialectical interaction with their opposites, striving towards plenitude. The concrete representation of many of these ideas, values, concepts, and hopes, as well as the obstacles which impede the people’s full humanization, constitute the themes of that epoch. These themes imply others which are opposing or even antithetical; they also indicate tasks to be carried out and fulfilled. Thus, historical themes are never isolated, independent, disconnected, or static; they are always interacting dialectically with their opposites. Nor can these themes be found anywhere except in the human-world relationship. The complex of interacting themes of an epoch constitutes its “thematic universe.”

面对这个辩证矛盾的“主题世界”，人们采取同样矛盾的立场：一些人努力维护结构，另一些人努力改变结构。随着作为现实表达的主题之间的对抗加深，现实主题和现实本身倾向于被神话化，从而形成了一种非理性和宗派主义的氛围。这种氛围有可能使主题失去其更深层的意义，并使其失去其特有的动态方面。在这种情况下，创造神话的非理性本身就成为一个基本主题。它的对立主题，即批判性和动态的世界观，力求揭示现实，揭开其神话化的面纱，并充分实现人类的任务：永久地改变现实，以利于人民的解放。

Confronted by this “universe of themes” in dialectical contradic­tion, persons take equally contradictory positions: some work to maintain the structures, others to change them. As antagonism deepens between themes which are the expression of reality, the re is a tendency for the themes and for reality itself to be mythicized, establishing a climate of irrationality and sectarianism. This climate threatens to drain the themes of their deeper significance and to deprive them of their characteristically dynamic aspect. In such a situation, myth-creating irrationality itself becomes a ­fundamental theme. Its opposing theme, the critical and dynamic view of the world, strives to unveil reality, unmask its mythicization, and achieve a full realization of the human task: the permanent transformation of reality in favor of the liberation of people.

归根结底，主题 19 既包含极限情境，又被极限情境所包含；它们所暗示的任务需要极限行为。当主题被极限情境所掩盖，从而无法被清晰地感知时，相应的任务——人们以历史行动的形式做出的反应——既不能真实地完成，也不能批判地完成。在这种情况下，人类无法超越极限情境，去发现在这些情境之外——与它们相矛盾的——存在着一种未经检验的可行性。

In the last analysis, the themes 19 both contain and are contained in limit-situations; the tasks they imply require limit-acts. When the themes are concealed by the limit-situations and thus are not clearly perceived, the corresponding tasks—people’s responses in the form of historical action—can be neither authentically nor critically fulfilled. In this situation, humans are unable to transcend the limitsituations to discover that beyond these situations—and in contradiction to them—lies an untested feasibility.

总之，极限情况意味着直接或间接地受益于这些情况的人的存在，以及被这些情况否定和抑制的人的存在。一旦后者开始将这些情况视为存在与更人性化之间的边界，而不是存在与虚无之间的边界，他们就会开始将他们日益批判性的行动导向实现这种感知中隐含的未经检验的可行性。另一方面，那些被当前的极限情况所服务的人将未经检验的可行性视为一种威胁性的极限情况，绝不能允许其实现，并采取行动维持现状。因此，对历史环境的解放行动不仅必须与生成主题相对应，而且必须与这些主题被感知的方式相对应。这一要求反过来又意味着另一项要求：对有意义的主题的调查。

In sum, limit-situations imply the existence of persons who are directly or indirectly served by these situations, and of those who are negated and curbed by them. Once the latter come to perceive these situations as the frontier between being and being more hu-man, rather than the frontier between being and nothingness, they begin to direct their increasingly critical actions towards ­achieving the untested feasibility implicit in that perception. On the other hand, those who are served by the present limit-situation regard the untested feasibility as a threatening limit-situation which must not be allowed to materialize, and act to maintain the status quo. Consequently, liberating actions upon an historical milieu must correspond not only to the generative themes but to the way in which these themes are perceived. This requirement in turn implies an-other: the investigation of meaningful thematics.

生成主题可以以同心圆的形式出现，从一般到特殊。最广泛的时代单位包括各种各样的单位和子单位——大陆、地区、国家等等——包含具有普遍性的主题。我认为我们时代的基本主题是统治——这意味着它的对立面，解放的主题，作为要实现的目标。正是这个折磨人的主题赋予了我们时代前面提到的人类学特征。为了实现人性化，这需要消除非人性的压迫，绝对有必要克服人被贬低为物的极限情况。

Generative themes can be located in concentric circles, ­moving from the general to the particular. The broadest epochal unit, which includes a diversified range of units and sub-units—continental, re-gional, national, and so forth—contains themes of a universal charac-ter. I consider the fundamental theme of our epoch to be that of domination—which implies its opposite, the theme of liberation, as the objective to be achieved. It is this tormenting theme which gives our epoch the anthropological character mentioned earlier. In order to achieve humanization, which presupposes the elimination of de-humanizing oppression, it is absolutely necessary to surmount the limit-situations in which people are reduced to things.

在较小的圆圈内，我们发现了社会（在同一大陆或不同大陆）所特有的主题和极限情况，这些社会通过这些主题和极限情况具有历史相似性。例如，不发达是第三世界社会特有的极限情况，它不能脱离依赖关系来理解。这种极限情况所隐含的任务是克服这些“客体”社会与大都市社会之间的矛盾关系；这项任务构成了第三世界未经检验的可行性。

Within the smaller circles, we find themes and limit-situations characteristic of societies (on the same continent or on different ­continents) which through these themes and limit-situations share historical similarities. For example, underdevelopment, which cannot be understood apart from the relationship of dependency, represents a limit-situation characteristic of societies of the Third World. The task implied by this limit-situation is to overcome the contradictory relation of these “object”-societies to the metropolitan societies; this task constitutes the untested feasibility for the Third World.

在更广泛的时代单位中，任何一个特定的社会，除了普遍的、大陆的或历史上相似的主题外，还包含自己的特殊主题，自己的极限情况。在更小的圈子里，同一个社会中可以发现主题的多样化，分为地区和子地区，所有这些都与社会整体相关。这些构成了时代的子单位。例如，在同一个民族单位中，人们可以发现“非同时代共存”的矛盾。

Any given society within the broader epochal unit contains, in addition to the universal, continental, or historically similar themes, its own particular themes, its own limit-situations. Within yet smaller circles, thematic diversifications can be found within the same society, divided into areas and sub-areas, all of which are re-lated to the societal whole. These constitute epochal sub-units. For example, within the same national unit one can find the contradiction of the “coexistence of the non-contemporaneous.”

在这些小单位中，民族主题的真正意义可能被感知到，也可能没有。它们可能只是被感觉到——有时甚至没有。但小单位中不存在主题是绝对不可能的。某个地区的个人没有感知到生成主题，或者以扭曲的方式感知到生成主题，这一事实可能只揭示了一种人们仍然被淹没的压迫的极限状态。

Within these sub-units, national themes may or may not be per­-ceived in their true significance. They may simply be felt— ­sometimes not even that. But the nonexistence of themes within the sub-units is absolutely impossible. The fact that individuals in a ­certain area do not perceive a generative theme, or perceive it in a distorted way, may only reveal a limit-situation of oppression in which people are still submerged.

一般而言，尚未完全感知极限情况的受支配意识只能理解其附带现象，并将作为极限情况属性的抑制力转移给附带现象。20这一 事实对于生成主题的研究非常重要。当人们缺乏对现实的批判性理解，将其理解为片段，而他们并不认为这些片段是整体的相互作用的构成要素时，他们就无法真正了解现实。要真正了解现实，他们必须颠倒他们的出发点：他们需要对背景有一个整体的了解，以便随后分离和隔离其构成要素，并通过这种分析更清楚地了解整体。

In general, a dominated consciousness which has not yet per-ceived a limit-situation in its totality apprehends only its epiphenomena and transfers to the latter the inhibiting force which is the property of the limit-situation.20 This fact is of great importance for the investigation of generative themes. When people lack a critical understanding of their reality, apprehending it in fragments which they do not perceive as interacting constituent elements of the whole, they cannot truly know that reality. To truly know it, they would have to reverse their starting point: they would need to have a total vision of the context in order subsequently to separate and isolate its constituent elements and by means of this analysis achieve a clearer perception of the whole.

这种努力对于主题研究方法论和问题提出式教育同样适用，即展示个人背景现实的重要维度，通过分析这些维度，他可以认识到各种组成部分之间的相互作用。同时，这些重要维度又由相互作用的部分组成，应被视为整体现实的维度。这样，对重要存在维度的批判性分析就有可能对极限情况产生新的批判性态度。对现实的感知和理解得到纠正，并获得新的深度。当用意识方法论进行调查时，对最小主题宇宙（相互作用中的生成主题）中包含的生成主题的调查，就会或开始向女性和男性介绍一种批判性思维方式来思考他们的世界。

Equally appropriate for the methodology of thematic investigation and for problem-posing education is this effort to present significant dimensions of an individual’s contextual reality, the analysis of which will make it possible for him to recognize the interaction of the ­various components. Meanwhile, the significant dimensions, which in their turn are constituted of parts in interaction, should be perceived as dimensions of total reality. In this way, a critical analysis of a significant existential dimension makes possible a new, critical attitude towards the limit-situations. The perception and comprehension of reality are rectified and acquire new depth. When ­carried out with a methodology of conscientização the investigation of the generative theme contained in the minimum thematic universe (the generative themes in interaction) thus introduces or begins to introduce women and men to a critical form of thinking about their world.

然而，如果人类认为现实是稠密的、不可穿透的和包罗万象的，就必须通过抽象的方式进行研究。这种方法不是将具体简化为抽象（这意味着否定其辩证性质），而是将两个要素视为对立面，在反思过程中辩证地相互关联。这种辩证的思维运动在分析一个具体的存在的“编码”情况时得到了完美的体现。21它 的“解码”需要从抽象到具体；这就需要从部分到整体，然后再回到部分；这反过来又要求主体在客体（编码的具体存在情况）中认出自己，并将客体认作他与其他主体共同存在的一种情况。如果解码得当，在编码情况的分析中发生的这种从抽象到具体的流动和回流运动会导致抽象被具体的批判性感知所取代，而具体的现实已经不再是密集的、难以理解的现实。

In the event, however, that human beings perceive reality as dense, impenetrable , and enveloping, it is indispensable to proceed with the investigation by means of abstraction. This method does not involve reducing the concrete to the abstract (which would signify the negation of its dialectical nature), but rather maintaining both elements as opposites which interrelate dialectically in the act of reflection. This dialectical movement of thought is exemplified perfectly in the analysis of a concrete existential, “coded” situation.21 Its “decoding” requires moving from the abstract to the concrete; this requires moving from the part to the whole and then returning to the parts; this in turn requires that the Subject recognize himself in the object (the coded concrete existential situation) and ­recognize the object as a situation in which he finds himself, together with other Subjects. If the decoding is well done, this movement of flux and reflux from the abstrct to the concrete which occurs in the ­analysis of a coded situation leads to the supersedence of the abstraction by the critical perception of the concrete, which has already ceased to be a dense, impenetrable reality.

当一个人面对一个编码的存在情境（一张通过抽象引向存在现实具体性的素描或照片）时，他倾向于“分裂”该编码情境。在解码过程中，这种分离对应于我们称之为“情境描述”的阶段，并有助于发现分离整体各部分之间的相互作用。这个整体（编码情境）以前只是被模糊地理解，随着思想从各个维度回流到它，它开始获得意义。然而，由于编码是存在情境的表征，解码者倾向于从表征迈向她所处并与之相处的具体情境。因此，可以从概念上解释为什么一旦客观现实不再看起来，个人就会开始对客观现实采取不同的行为犹如一条死胡同，并呈现出其真实的面貌：人类必须面对的挑战。

When an individual is presented with a coded existential ­situation (a sketch or photograph which leads by abstraction to the concreteness of existential reality), his tendency is to “split” that coded situation. In the process of decoding, this separation corresponds to the stage we call the “description of the situation,” and facilitates the ­discovery of the interaction among the parts of the disjoined whole. This whole (the coded situation), which previously had been only diffusely apprehended, begins to acquire meaning as thought flows back to it from the various dimensions. Since; however, the coding is the representation of an existential situation, the decoder tends to take the step from the representation to the very concrete situation in which and with which she finds herself. It is thus possible to explain conceptually why individuals begin to behave differently with regard to objective reality, once that reality has ceased to look like a blind alley and has taken on its true aspect: a challenge which human beings must meet.

在解码的所有阶段，人们都会外化他们对世界的看法。在他们思考和面对世界的方式中——宿命论、动态或静态——可以找到他们的生成主题。一个没有具体表达生成主题的群体——这一事实似乎意味着主题的不存在——相反，它暗示了一个非常戏剧性的主题：沉默的主题。沉默的主题表明，面对极限情况的压倒性力量，人们会保持沉默。

In all the stages of decoding, people exteriorize their view of the world. And in the way they think about and face the world—­fatalistically, dynamically, or statically—their generative themes may be found. A group which does not concretely express a generative thematics—a fact which might appear to imply the nonexistence of themes—is, on the contrary, suggesting a very dramatic theme: the theme of silence. The theme of silence suggests a structure of mut-ism in face of the overwhelming force of the limit-situations.

我必须再次强调，生成主题不能脱离现实而存在于人身上，也不能脱离人而存在于现实中，更不能脱离“无人区”而存在于现实中。它只能在人与世界的关系中被理解。研究生成主题就是研究人们对现实的思考和人们对现实的行动，这是他们的实践。正是出于这个原因，所提出的方法要求研究者和人们（通常被视为研究对象）应该作为共同研究者。男人和女人在探索主题方面采取的态度越积极，他们对现实的批判意识就越深化，并且在阐明这些主题时，他们就越能掌握现实。

I must re-emphasize that the generative theme cannot be found in people, divorced from reality; nor yet in reality, divorced from ­people; much less in “no man’s land.” It can only be apprehended in the human-world relationship. To investigate the generative theme is to investigate people’s thinking about reality and people’s action upon reality, which is their praxis. For precisely this reason, the methodology proposed requires that the investigators and the people (who would normally be considered objects of that investigation) should act as co-investigators. The more active an attitude men and women take in regard to the exploration of their thematics, the more they deepen their critical awareness of reality and, in spelling out those thematics, take possession of that reality.

有些人可能认为，将民众作为调查者纳入他们自己有意义的主题探索之中是不可取的：他们的干扰性影响（注：那些对自己的教育最感兴趣或应该最感兴趣的人的“干扰”）将“玷污”调查结果，从而牺牲调查的客观性。这种观点错误地假定主题以其最初的客观纯粹性存在于人之外——就好像主题是事物一样。实际上，主题存在于人们与世界的关系中，参考具体的事实。同样的客观事实可以在不同的时代子单元中唤起不同的生成主题复合体。因此，给定的客观事实、女性和男性对这一事实的看法以及生成主题之间存在着某种关系。

Some may think it inadvisable to include the people as investigators in the search for their own meaningful thematics: that their intrusive influence (n.b., the “intrusion” of those who are most inter-ested—or ought to be—in their own education) will “adulterate” the findings and thereby sacrifice the objectivity of the investigation. This view mistakenly presupposes that themes exist, in their ­original objective purity, outside people—as if themes were things. Actually, themes exist in people in their relations with the world, with refer-ence to concrete facts. The same objective fact could evoke ­different complexes of generative themes in different epochal sub-units. There is, therefore, a relation between the given objective fact, the perception women and men have of this fact, and the generative themes.

人们表达了一个有意义的主题，如果他们改变了对主题所指的客观事实的感知，那么某一时刻的表达就会与之前有所不同。从调查者的角度来看，重要的是要发现人们想象“既定事实”的起点，并核实在调查过程中他们对现实的感知方式是否发生了任何转变。（当然，客观现实保持不变。如果对现实的感知在调查过程中发生变化，这一事实不会损害调查的有效性。）

A meaningful thematics is expressed by people, and a given mo-ment of expression will differ from an earlier moment, if they have changed their perception of the objective facts to which the themes refer. From the investigator’s point of view, the important thing is to detect the starting point at which the people visualize the “given” and to verify whether or not during the process of investigation any transformation has occurred in their way of perceiving reality. (Objective reality, of course, remains unchanged. If the perception of that reality changes in the course of the investigation, that fact does not impair the validity of the investigation.)

我们必须认识到，有意义的主题中所隐含的愿望、动机和目标是人类的愿望、动机和目标。它们不是作为静态实体存在于“外面”的某个地方；它们正在发生。它们与人类本身一样具有历史意义；因此，不能脱离人类来理解它们。要理解这些主题并理解它们，就必须理解体现这些主题的人和它们所指的现实。但是——正因为不可能脱离人来理解这些主题——相关人员也必须理解它们。因此，主题调查成为对现实和自我意识的共同追求，这使得这种调查成为教育过程或解放性文化行动的起点。

We must realize that the aspirations, the motives, and the objectives implicit in the meaningful thematics are human aspirations, motives, and objectives. They do not exist “out there” somewhere, as static entities; they are occurring. They are as historical as human beings themselves; consequently, they cannot be apprehended apart from them. To apprehend these themes and to understand them is to understand both the people who embody them and the ­reality to which they refer. But—precisely because it is not possible to understand these themes apart from people—it is necessary that those concerned understand them as well. Thematic investigation thus becomes a common striving towards awareness of reality and towards self-awareness, which makes this investigation a starting point for the educational process or for cultural action of a liberating character.

调查的真正危险不在于调查对象发现自己是共同调查者，可能会“篡改”分析结果。相反，危险在于将调查的重点从有意义的主题转移到人本身，从而将人视为调查对象的风险。由于这项调查将作为制定教师-学生和学生-教师结合对同一对象的认知的教育计划的基础，因此调查本身也必须基于行动的互惠性。

The real danger of the investigation is not that the supposed objects of the investigation, discovering themselves to be co-investi­gators, might “adulterate” the analytical results. On the contrary, the danger lies in the risk of shifting the focus of the investigation from the meaningful themes to the people themselves, thereby ­treating the people as objects of the investigation. Since this investi­gation is to serve as a basis for developing an educational program in which teacher-student and students-teachers combine their cognitions of the same object, the investigation itself must likewise be based on reciprocity of action.

主题调查发生在人类领域，不能沦为机械行为。作为探索、知识和创造的过程，它要求研究者发现问题之间的相互渗透，发现有意义的主题之间的联系。当研究最具批判性时，它才是最有教育意义的；当研究避免了部分或“聚焦”现实观点的狭隘轮廓，并坚持对整体现实的理解时，它才是最有批判性的。因此，寻找有意义的主题的过程应该包括对主题之间联系的关注、对这些主题提出问题的关注以及对其历史文化背景的关注。

Thematic investigation, which occurs in the realm of the human, cannot be reduced to a mechanical act. As a process of search, of knowledge, and thus of creation, it requires the investigators to ­discover the interpenetration of problems, in the linking of meaning­ful themes. The investigation will be most educational when it is most critical, and most critical when it avoids the narrow outlines of partial or “focalized” views of reality, and sticks to the comprehension of total reality. Thus, the process of searching for the meaningful thematics should include a concern for the links between themes, a concern to pose these themes as problems, and a concern for their historical-cultural context.

正如教育者不能制定一个计划来呈现给人们一样，研究者也不能从预先确定的点开始制定研究主题世界的“路线图” 。教育和旨在支持教育的研究都必须是“同情”活动，这是该词的词源意义。也就是说，它们必须由交流和对现实的共同体验组成，而现实是在不断“形成”的复杂性中被感知到的。

Just as the educator may not elaborate a program to present to the people, neither may the investigator elaborate “itineraries” for researching the thematic universe, starting from points which he has predetermined. Both education and the investigation designed to support it must be “sympathetic” activities, in the etymological sense of the word. That is, they must consist of communication and of the common experience of a reality perceived in the complexity of its constant “becoming.”

那些以科学客观性的名义将有机物变成无机物、将正在形成的东西变成现有的东西、将生命变成死亡的研究者，是一个害怕变化的人。他或她认为变化（这并不被否认，但也不是所希望的）不是生命的迹象，而是死亡和衰败的迹象。他或她确实想研究变化——但是为了阻止它，而不是为了刺激或加深它。然而，将变化视为死亡的迹象，并将人作为被动的研究对象以得出僵化的模型，一个人就暴露了自己作为生命杀手的本性。

The investigator who, in the name of scientific objectivity, transforms the organic into something inorganic, what is becoming into what is, life into death, is a person who fears change. He or she sees in change (which is not denied, but neither is it desired) not a sign of life, but a sign of death and decay. He or she does want to study change—but in order to stop it, not in order to stimulate or deepen it. However, in seeing change as a sign of death and in making ­people the passive objects of investigation in order to arrive at rigid models, one betrays their own character as a killer of life.

我再说一遍：主题研究涉及对人们思想的研究——这种思想只发生在人们共同寻求现实的过程中。我不能代替他人思考，也不能没有他人思考，他人也不能代替我思考。即使人们的思想是迷信或幼稚的，也只有当他们在行动中重新思考他们的假设时，他们才能改变。产生并根据自己的思想采取行动——而不是消费他人的思想——必须构成这一过程。

I repeat: the investigation of thematics involves the ­investigation of the people’s thinking—thinking which occurs only in and among people together seeking out reality. I cannot think for others or ­without others, nor can others think for me. Even if the people’s thinking is superstitious or naive, it is only as they rethink their assumptions in action that they can change. Producing and acting upon their own ideas—not consuming those of others—must consti­tute that process.

人们作为“处境”中的存在，发现自己根植于时空条件，这些条件标记着他们，他们也标记着这些条件。他们会倾向于反思自己的“处境”，直到他们受到挑战并采取行动。人类之所以存在，是因为他们处境中。他们不仅批判性地反思自己的存在，而且批判性地采取行动，他们就越存在。

People, as beings “in a situation,” find themselves rooted in tem­-poral-spatial conditions which mark them and which they also mark. They will tend to reflect on their own “situationality” to the extent that they are challenged by it to act upon it. Human beings are because they are in a situation. And they will be more the more they not only critically reflect upon their existence but critically act upon it.

对情境的反思是对存在条件本身的反思：人们通过批判性思维发现彼此“处于一种情境中”。只有当这种情境不再表现为一种密集的、笼罩性的现实或一条令人痛苦的死胡同，人们才能将其视为一种客观的、有问题的情境时，承诺才会存在。人类从沉浸中走出来，获得了在现实被揭露时进行干预的能力。因此，对现实的干预——历史意识本身——代表了从出现向前迈出的一步，并源于对情境的意识化。意识化是所有出现特有的意识态度的深化。

Reflection upon situationality is reflection about the very condition of existence: critical thinking by means of which people discover each other to be “in a situation.” Only as this situation ceases to ­present itself as a dense, enveloping reality or a tormenting blind alley, and they can come to perceive it as an objective-problematic situation—only then can commitment exist. Humankind emerge from their submersion and acquire the ability to intervene in ­reality as it is unveiled. Intervention in reality—historical awareness it-self—thus represents a step forward from emergence, and results from the conscientização of the situation. Conscientização is the ­deepening of the attitude of awareness characteristic of all emergence.

因此，任何深化历史意识的主题研究都是真正具有教育意义的，而所有真正的教育都研究思想。教育者和人民对人民思想的研究越多，从而共同接受教育，他们就会继续研究得越多。在问题提出型教育概念中，教育和主题研究只是同一过程的不同时刻。

Every thematic investigation which deepens historical awareness is thus really educational, while all authentic education investigates thinking. The more educators and the people investigate the peo­-ple’s thinking, and are thus jointly educated, the more they continue to investigate. Education and thematic investigation, in the prob­-lem-posing concept of education, are simply different moments of the same process.

与银行式教育方法的反对话和非交流式“存款”相反，问题提出式教育方法的课程内容——典型的对话式——是由学生的世界观构成和组织的，学生自己的生成主题就存在于其中。因此，内容不断扩展和更新。跨学科团队中的对话式教师的任务是研究他们调查发现的主题世界，向他或她最初从他们那里获得该主题世界的人“重新呈现”该主题世界——并且不是以讲座的形式“重新呈现”，而是以问题的形式“重新呈现”。

In contrast with the antidialogical and non-communicative “de-posits” of the banking method of education, the program content of the problem-posing method—dialogical par excellence—is consti­tuted and organized by the students’ view of the world, where their own generative themes are found. The content thus constantly ex-pands and renews itself. The task of the dialogical teacher in an interdisciplinary team working on the thematic universe revealed by their investigation is to “re-present” that universe to the people from whom she or he first received it—and “re-present” it not as a lecture, but as a problem.

比如说，一个团体负责协调一个在文盲率很高的农村地区的成人教育计划。该计划包括扫盲运动和扫盲后阶段。在前一个阶段，问题提出式教育寻找和研究“生成词”；在扫盲后阶段，问题提出式教育寻找和研究“生成主题”。

Let us say, for example, that a group has the responsibility of ­coordinating a plan for adult education in a peasant area with a high percentage of illiteracy. The plan includes a literacy campaign and a post-literacy phase. During the former stage, problem-posing education seeks out and investigates the “generative word”; in the post­literacy stage, it seeks out and investigates the “generative theme.”

但是，我们在此只考虑生成主题或有意义主题的调查。22一旦 调查人员确定了他们将要工作的区域，并通过第二手资料对该区域有了初步了解，他们就会开始调查的第一阶段。这一开始（就像任何人类活动的开始一样）涉及困难和风险，这些困难和风险在某种程度上是正常的，尽管在与该地区的个人的第一次接触中并不总是很明显。在第一次接触中，调查人员需要让相当多的人同意举行一次非正式会议，在此期间他们可以谈论他们在该地区存在的目的。在这次会议上，他们解释了调查的原因、如何进行调查以及将如何使用调查；他们进一步解释说，如果没有相互理解和信任的关系，调查将是不可能的。如果参与者同意调查和后续过程，23 调查人员应该在参与者中呼吁志愿者担任助手。这些志愿者将收集有关该地区生活的一系列必要数据。但更重要的是这些志愿者积极参与调查。

Let us here, however, consider only the investigation of the generative themes or the meaningful thematics.22 Once the ­investigators have determined the area in which they will work and have acquired a preliminary acquaintance with the area through secondary sources, they initiate the first stage of the investigation. This beginning (like any beginning in any human activity) involves difficulties and risks which are to a certain point normal, although they are not always evident in the first contact with the individuals of the area. In this first contact, the investigators need to get a significant number of persons to agree to an informal meeting during which they can talk about the objectives of their presence in the area. In this meeting they explain the reason for the investigation, how it is to be carried out, and to what use it will be put; they further explain that the investigation will be impossible without a relation of mutual understanding and trust. If the participants agree both to the investigation and to the subsequent process,23 the investigators should call for volunteers among the participants to serve as assistants. These volunteers will gather a series of necessary data about the life of the area. Of even greater importance, however, is the active presence of these volunteers in the investigation.

与此同时，调查员们开始自己前往该地区，他们从不强迫自己，而是以同情的观察者的身份，对他们所看到的东西抱有理解的态度。虽然调查员带着影响该地区的价值观来到该地区是正常的，这并不意味着他们可以把主题研究变成一种强加这些价值观的手段。这些价值观的唯一维度是，人们希望被研究主题的人能够分享这些价值观（假设研究者具备这种品质），即对世界的批判性认识，这意味着一种接近现实的正确方法，以便揭示现实。批判性认识是不能强加的。因此，从一开始，主题研究就表现为一种教育追求，一种文化行动。

Meanwhile, the investigators begin their own visits to the area, never forcing themselves, but acting as sympathetic observers with an attitude of understanding towards what they see. While it is ­normal for investigators to come to the area with values which influence their perceptions, this does not mean that they may tra nsform the thematic investigation into a means of imposing these values. The only dimension of these values which it is hoped the people whose thematics are being investigated will come to share (it is ­presumed that the investigators possess this quality) is a critical ­perception of the world, which implies a correct method of ap-proaching reality in order to unveil it. And critical perception cannot be imposed. Thus, from the very beginning, thematic investigation is expressed as an educational pursuit, as cultural action.

在访问期间，研究人员将批判性“目标”放在研究区域上，仿佛这是他们要破译的巨大、独特、鲜活的“密码”。他们把该区域视为一个整体，一次又一次地试图通过分析给他们留下深刻印象的部分维度来“分裂”它。通过这一过程，他们扩大了对各个部分如何相互作用的理解，这将有助于他们日后洞察整体本身。

During their visits, the investigators set their critical “aim” on the area under study, as if it were for them an enormous, unique, living “code” to be deciphered. They regard the area as a ­totality, and visit upon visit attempt to “split” it by analyzing the partial dimensions which impress them. Through this process they expand their understanding of how the various parts interact, which will later help them penetrate the totality itself.

在这个解码阶段，调查人员观察该地区生活的某些时刻——有时是直接观察，有时是通过与当地居民的非正式交谈。他们把一切都记录在笔记本里，包括那些看似不重要的内容：人们说话的方式、他们的生活方式、他们在教堂和工作中的行为。他们记录人们的习语：他们的表达方式、他们的词汇和他们的句法（不是他们的错误发音，而是他们构建思维的方式）。24

During this decoding stage, the investigators observe certain mo-ments of the life of the area—sometimes directly, sometimes by means of informal conversations with the inhabitants. They ­register ­everything in their notebooks, including apparently unimportant items: the way the people talk, their style of life, their behavior at church and at work. They record the idiom of the people: their expressions, their vocabulary, and their syntax (not their incorrect pronunciation, but rather the way they construct their thought).24

调查人员必须在不同的环境下观察该地区：田间劳作、当地协会的会议（注意参与者的行为、使用的语言和官员与成员之间的关系）、妇女和年轻人所扮演的角色、休闲时间、游戏和体育活动、与家中人员的对话（注意夫妻和亲子关系的例子）。在对该区域进行初步调查时，任何活动都不能逃过调查人员的注意。

It is essential that the investigators observe the area under ­varying circumstances: labor in the fields, meetings of a local association (noting the behavior of the participants, the language used, and the relations between the officers and the members), the role played by women and by young people, leisure hours, games and sports, conversations with people in their homes (noting examples of husband-wife and parent-child relationships). No activity must escape the attention of the investigators during the initial survey of the area.

每次观察访问后，调查员应起草一份简短的报告，供整个团队讨论，以评估专业调查员和当地助理的初步发现。为了方便助理的参与，评估会议应在当地举行。

After each observation visit, the investigator should draw up a brief report to be discussed by the entire team, in order to eval-uate the preliminary findings of both the professional investigators and the local assistants. To facilitate the participation of the assist­ants, the evaluation meetings should be held in the area itself.

评估会议是解码独特生活密码的第二阶段。每个人在解码文章中都会讲述自己对某一事件或情况的看法或感受，他的阐述向所有其他解码者提出了挑战，向他们重新呈现了他们自己一直关注的同一现实。此时，他们通过其他人的“考虑”来“重新考虑”自己之前的“考虑”。因此，每个解码者对现实的分析都会以对话的方式将他们全部送回脱节的整体，而这个整体又会成为一个整体，引发调查人员进行新的分析，之后将举行新的评估和批评会议。居民代表作为调查小组的成员参与所有活动。

The evaluation meetings represent a second stage in the ­decoding of the unique living code. As each person, in his decoding essay, relates how he perceived or felt a certain occurrence or situation, his exposition challenges all the other decoders by re-presenting to them the same reality upon which they have themselves been intent. At this moment they “re-consider,” through the “considerations” of others, their own previous “consideration.” Thus the analysis of reality made by each individual decoder sends them all back, dialogi-cally, to the disjoined whole which once more becomes a totality evoking a new analysis by the investigators, following which a new evaluative and critical meeting will be held. Representatives of the inhabitants participate in all activities as members of the investigating team.

团体越是将整体分裂和重新整合，他们就越接近涉及该地区居民的主要矛盾和次要矛盾的核心。通过找到这些矛盾的核心，调查人员甚至在这个阶段就能够组织他们的教育行动的计划内容。事实上，如果内容反映了这些矛盾，它无疑将包含该地区有意义的主题。而且可以肯定的是，基于这些观察的行动比基于“来自高层的决定”的行动更有可能成功。然而，调查人员不应该被这种可能性所诱惑。从对探究这些矛盾核心（其中包括社会主要矛盾作为一个更大的时代单元）的目的，就是研究居民对这些矛盾的认识水平。

The more the group divide and reintegrate the whole, the more closely they approach the nuclei of the principal and secondary ­contradictions which involve the inhabitants of the area. By locating these nuclei of contradictions, the investigators might even at this stage be able to organize the program content of their educational action. Indeed, if the content reflected these contradictions, it would undoubtedly contain the meaningful thematics of the area. And one can safely affirm that action based on these observations would be much more likely to succeed than that based on “decisions from the top.” The investigators should not, however, be tempted by this ­possibility. The basic thing, starting from the initial perception of these nuclei of contradictions (which include the principal contradic­tion of society as a larger epochal unit) is to study the inhabitants’ level of awareness of these contradictions.

从本质上讲，这些矛盾构成了极限情境，包含主题，并表明了任务。如果个人陷入这些极限情境而无法摆脱它们，那么他们对这些情境的主题就是宿命论，而主题所暗示的任务就是没有任务。因此，尽管极限情境是唤起个人需求的客观现实，但我们必须与这些个人一起调查他们对这些情境的认识水平。

Intrinsically, these contradictions constitute limit-situations, in-volve themes, and indicate tasks. If individuals are caught up in and are unable to separate themselves from these limit-situations, their theme in reference to these situations is fatalism, and the task im-plied by the theme is the lack of a task. Thus, although the limit-­situations are objective realities which call forth needs in individ-uals, one must investigate with these individuals their level of awareness of these situations.

极限情境作为一种具体的现实，可以唤起不同领域（甚至同一领域的子领域）的人提出截然不同的主题和任务。因此，研究者的基本关注点应该是专注于戈德曼所说的“真实意识”和“潜在意识”的知识。

A limit-situation as a concrete reality can call forth from persons in different areas (and even in sub-areas of the same area) quite opposite themes and tasks. Thus, the basic concern of the investigators should be to concentrate on the knowledge of what Goldman calls “real consciousness” and the “potential consciousness.”

现实意识是经验现实的不同因素相互对抗并被潜在意识实现的多重障碍和偏差的结果。25

Real consciousness [is] the result of the multiple obstacles and deviations that the different factors of empirical reality put into opposition and submit for realization by [the] potential con-­sciousness.25

真实意识意味着无法感知超越极限情况的“未经检验的可行性”。但是，尽管未经检验的可行性无法在“真实[或当前]意识”的层面上实现，但它可以通过“测试行动”来实现，从而揭示其迄今为止未被感知的可行性。未经检验的可行性和真实意识是相关的，测试行动和潜在意识也是相关的。戈德曼的“潜在意识”概念类似于尼古拉所说的“未经感知的可行解决方案” 26 （我们的“未经检验的可行性”），与“感知的可行解决方案”和“当前实践的解决方案”形成对比，后者对应于戈德曼的“现实意识”。因此，调查者在调查的第一阶段可能大致理解了矛盾的复杂性，但这并不意味着他们就可以开始构建教育行动的计划内容。这种对现实的感知仍然是他们自己的，而不是人民的。

Real consciousness implies the impossibility of perceiving the “un-tested feasibility” which lies beyond the limit-situations. But whereas the untested feasibility cannot be achieved at the level of “real [or present] consciousness,” it can be realized through ­“testing action” which reveals its hitherto unperceived viability. The un-tested feasibility and real consciousness are related, as are testing action and potential consciousness. Goldman’s concept of “­potential consciousness” is similar to what Nicolaï terms “unperceived pratica­ble solutions”26 (our “untested feasibility”), in contrast to “perceived practicable solutions” and “presently practiced solutions,” which ­correspond to Goldman’s “real consciousness.” ­Accordingly, the fact that the investigators may in the first stage of the investigation ap-proximately apprehend the complex of contradictions does not au-thorize them to begin to structure the program content of ­educational action. This perception of reality is still their own, not that of the people.

调查的第二阶段就是从对矛盾的复杂理解开始的。调查人员始终以团队的形式行动，选择其中一些矛盾来制定用于主题调查的编纂。由于编纂（草图或照片）27 是解码者进行批判性分析的对象，因此这些编纂的准备必须遵循某些原则，而不是通常的制作视觉辅助工具的原则。

It is with the apprehension of the complex of contradictions that the second stage of the investigation begins. Always acting as a team, the investigators will select some of these contradictions to develop the codifications to be used in the thematic investigation. Since the codifications (sketches or photographs)27 are the objects which mediate the decoders in their critical analysis, the preparation of these codifications must be guided by certain principles other than the usual ones for making visual aids.

第一个要求是，这些编码必须代表被研究主题的个人所熟悉的情况，以便他们能够轻松识别这些情况（以及他们与这些情况的关系）。不允许（无论是在调查过程中，还是在后续阶段，当有意义的主题作为节目内容呈现时）向参与者呈现不熟悉的现实图景。后一种程序（虽然是辩证的，因为分析不熟悉的现实的个人可以将其与自己的现实进行比较，并发现各自的局限性）不能先于参与者沉浸状态所决定的更基本程序，即分析自己现实的个人意识到他们先前扭曲的感知并由此对现实产生新感知的过程。

The first requirement is that these codifications must necessarily represent situations familiar to the individuals whose thematics are being examined, so that they can easily recognize the situations (and thus their own relation to them). It is inadmissible (whether ­during the process of investigation or in the following stage, when the mean­-ingful thematics are presented as program content) to present pictures of reality unfamiliar to the participants. The latter procedure (although dialectical, because individuals analyzing an unfamiliar re­-ality could compare it with their own and discover the limitations of each) cannot precede the more basic one dictated by the partici-pants’ state of submersion, that is, the process in which individuals analyzing their own reality become aware of their prior, distorted perceptions and thereby come to have a new perception of that ­reality.

编纂法典的一项同样基本的要求是，其主题核心既不能过于明确，也不能过于神秘。前者可能会沦为纯粹的抽象概念。ganda，除了陈述显然预先确定的内容之外，无需进行真正的解码。后者冒着看起来像谜题或猜谜游戏的风险。由于它们代表存在的情况，因此编纂应该在复杂性中保持简单，并提供各种解码可能性，以避免宣传的洗脑倾向。编纂不是口号；它们是可认知的对象，是解码者批判性反思应该针对的挑战。

An equally fundamental requirement for the preparation of the codifications is that their thematic nucleus be neither overly explicit nor overly enigmatic. The former may degenerate into mere propaganda, with no real decoding to be done beyond stating the obviously predetermined content. The latter runs the risk of appearing to be a puzzle or a guessing game. Since they represent existential situations, the codifications should be simple in their complexity and offer various decoding possibilities in order to avoid the brainwashing tendencies of propaganda. Codifications are not slogans; they are cognizable objects, challenges towards which the critical reflection of the decoders should be directed.

为了在解码过程中提供各种分析可能性，编码应以“主题扇”的形式组织。当解码者反思编码时，编码应向其他主题的方向展开。这种展开（如果主题内容太明确或太神秘，则不会发生）对于理解主题及其对立面之间存在的辩证关系是必不可少的。因此，反映存在情况的编码必须客观地构成一个整体。其元素必须在整体的构成中相互作用。

In order to offer various possibilities of analysis in the ­decoding process, the codifications should be organized as a “thematic fan.” As the decoders reflect on the codifications, the codifications should open up in the direction of other themes. This opening up (which does not occur if the thematic content is either too explicit or too enigmatic) is indispensable to the perception of the dialectical relations which exist between the themes and their opposites. Accordingly, the codifications reflecting an existential situation must ­objectively constitute a totality. Its elements must interact in the makeup of the whole.

在解码过程中，参与者将主题外化，从而明确表达他们对世界的“真实意识”。在这样做的过程中，他们开始看到自己在实际经历他们现在正在分析的情况时是如何行动的，从而达到“对自己先前感知的感知”。通过实现这种意识，他们开始以不同的方式感知现实；通过拓宽感知的视野，他们更容易在“背景意识”中发现现实的两个维度之间的辩证关系。

In the process of decoding, the participants externalize their the-matics and thereby make explicit their “real consciousness” of the world. As they do this, they begin to see how they themselves acted while actually experiencing the situation they are now ­analyzing, and thus reach a “perception of their previous perception.” By achieving this awareness, they come to perceive reality differently; by broadening the horizon of their perception, they discover more easily in their “background awareness” the dialectical relations be-tween the two dimensions of reality.

通过激发“对先前感知的感知”和“对先前知识的认知”，解码会刺激新感知的出现和新知识的发展。随着教育计划的启动，新的感知和知识会系统地延续下去，教育计划将未经检验的可行性转化为测试行动，因为潜在意识会取代现实意识。

By stimulating “perception of the previous perception” and “knowledge of the previous knowledge,” decoding stimulates the appearance of a new perception and the development of new know­ledge. The new perception and knowledge are systematically continued with the inauguration of the educational plan, which transforms the untested feasibility into testing action, as potential consciousness supersedes real consciousness.

编纂法典还需要尽可能不仅如此， 它们还应该代表构成研究领域矛盾体系的“包容性”矛盾。28在准备这些“包容性”法典时，其中“包含”的其他矛盾也应予以法典化。前者的解码将通过后者的解码辩证地澄清。

Preparing the codifications further requires that insofar as possible they should represent contradictions “inclusive” of others which constitute the system of contradictions of the area under study.28 As each of these “inclusive” codifications is prepared, the other contradictions “contained” therein should also be codified. The decoding of the former will be dialectically clarified by the decoding of the latter.

在这方面，智利最重要的政府机构之一：农业发展研究所(INDAP) 的智利年轻公务员加布里埃尔·博德 (Gabriel Bode) 为我们的方法做出了非常宝贵的贡献。29 在后识字阶段使用这种方法时，博德观察到，只有当编纂的内容直接与农民的感受需求相关时，农民才会对讨论感兴趣。编纂中的任何偏差，以及教育者将解码讨论引导到其他领域的任何尝试，都会导致沉默和冷漠。另一方面，他观察到，即使编纂30 以农民的感受需求为中心，农民也无法系统地集中精力进行讨论，讨论经常偏离主题，无法达成综合。此外，他们几乎从未意识到他们感受到的需求与这些需求的直接和间接原因之间的关系。可以说，他们未能察觉到超越引起他们需求的极限情况的未经检验的可行性。

In this connection, a very valuable contribution to our method has been made by Gabriel Bode, a young Chilean civil servant in one of the most significant Chilean governmental institutions: the Instituto de Desarrollo Agropecuario (INDAP).29 During his use of this method in the post-literacy stage, Bode observed that the peasants became interested in the discussion only when the codification related directly to their felt needs. Any deviation in the codification, as well as any attempt by the educator to guide the decoding discus­sion into other areas, produced silence and indifference. On the other hand, he observed that even when the codification30 centered on their felt needs the peasants could not manage to concentrate systematically on the discussion, which often digressed to the point of never reaching a synthesis. Also, they almost never perceived the relationship of their felt needs to the direct and indirect causes of these needs. One might say that they failed to perceive the untested feasibility lying beyond the limit-situations which engendered their needs.

博德随后决定尝试同时投射不同的情境；他的贡献的价值就在于这种技术。最初，他投射了一个非常简单的存在情境编码。他将他的第一个编码称为“基本”；它代表了基本核心，并展开为延伸到“辅助”编码的主题扇形。在解码基本编码后，教育者将其投射的图像保留为参考为参与者提供指导，并陆续将辅助编纂与它一起提出。通过后者，这些编纂与基本编纂直接相关，他维持了参与者的浓厚兴趣，从而使他们能够达成综合。

Bode then decided to experiment with the simultaneous projec­tion of different situations; in this technique lies the value of his ­contribution. Initially, he projects a very simple codification of an existential situation. He terms his first codification “essential”; it ­represents the basic nucleus and opens up into a thematic fan ex-tending to “auxiliary” codifications. After the essential codification is decoded, the educator maintains its projected image as a reference for the participants and successively projects alongside it the auxiliary codifications. By means of the latter, which are directly related to the essential codification, he sustains the vivid interest of the ­participants, who are thereby enabled to reach a synthesis.

加布里埃尔·博德的伟大成就在于，他通过基本法典和辅助法典之间的辩证法，成功地向参与者传达了一种整体感。那些原本沉浸在现实中、仅仅感觉到自己需要的人，从现实中走出来，感知到自己需要的原因。这样，他们就能更快地超越现实意识的层次，进入潜在意识的层次。

The great achievement of Gabriel Bode is that, by means of the dialectics between the essential and the auxiliary codifications, he has managed to communicate to the participants a sense of ­totality. Individuals who were submerged in reality, merely feeling their needs, emerge from reality and perceive the causes of their needs. In this way, they can go beyond the level of real consciousness to that of potential consciousness much more rapidly.

编纂工作准备就绪，跨学科团队研究了所有可能的主题方面后，调查人员便开始调查的第三阶段，返回该区域，在“主题调查圈”中发起解码对话。31这些 讨论解码了前一阶段准备的材料，并被录音，以供跨学科团队进行后续分析。32除了担任解码协调员的调查员外，还有另外两名专家——一名心理学家和一名社会学家——参加会议。他们的任务是 记录和记录解码者的重要（和看似无关紧要的）反应。

Once the codifications have been prepared and all their possible thematic facets have been studied by the interdisciplinary team, the investigators begin the third stage of the investigation by returning to the area to initiate decoding dialogues in the “thematic investiga­tion circles.”31 These discussions, which decode the material pre­-pared in the preceding stage, are taped for subequent analysis by the interdisciplinary team.32 In addition to the investigator acting as decoding co-ordinator, two other specialists—a psychologist and a sociologist—attend the meetings. Their task is to note and record the significant (and apparently insignificant) reactions of the de­-coders.

在解码过程中，协调员不仅必须听主题调查圈不仅要向个人提出问题，还要向他们提出挑战，既要提出问题，也要提出他们自己的答案。由于方法论的宣泄力量，主题调查圈的参与者会外化一系列关于他们自己、世界和他人的情感和观点，而这些情感和观点在不同的环境下也许不会表达出来。

During the decoding process, the co-ordinator must not only listen to the individuals but must challenge them, posing as problems both the codified existential situation and their own answers. Due to the cathartic force of the methodology, the participants of the thematic investigation circles externalize a series of sentiments and opinions about themselves, the world, and others, that perhaps they would not express under different circumstances.

在圣地亚哥进行的一项专题调查33 中，一群廉租房居民讨论了这样一个场景：一个醉汉走在街上，三个年轻人在街角交谈。小组成员评论说：“那里唯一一个对国家有生产力和有用的人就是那个酒鬼，他工作了一整天，工资很低，正在回家，他担心家人，因为他不能照顾他们的需要。他是唯一的工人。他是一个体面的工人，也是像我们一样的酒鬼。”

In one of the thematic investigations33 carried out in Santiago, a group of tenement residents discussed a scene showing a drunken man walking on the street and three young men conversing on the corner. The group participants commented that “the only one there who is productive and useful to his country is the souse who is returning home after working all day for low wages and who is worried about his family because he can’t take care of their needs. He is the only worker. He is a decent worker and a souse like us.”

调查员34 原本打算研究酗酒的各个方面。如果他向参与者提供一份他自己精心设计的问卷，他可能不会得到上述反应。如果直接询问，他们甚至可能会否认自己曾经喝过酒。但在他们对他们能够识别的存在情境的编纂的评论中，他们说出了他们真正的感受。

The investigator34 had intended to study aspects of alcoholism. He probably would not have elicited the above responses if he had presented the participants with a questionnaire he had elaborated himself. If asked directly, they might even have denied ever taking a drink themselves. But in their comments on the codification of an existential situation they could recognize, and in which they could recognize themselves, they said what they really felt.

这些宣言有两个重要方面。一方面，它们将低工资、受剥削的感觉和酗酒之间的联系表达出来——酗酒是逃避现实、克服无所作为的挫败感的一种尝试、最终自我毁灭的一种解决方案。另一方面，它们表明需要高度评价醉汉。他是“唯一对国家有用的人，因为他工作，而其他人只会闲聊”。在赞扬了醉汉之后，参与者将自己与他视为同样喝酒的工人——“体面的工人”。

There are two important aspects to these declarations. On the one hand, they verbalize the connection between earning low wages, feeling exploited, and getting drunk—getting drunk as a flight from reality, as an attempt to overcome the frustration of inaction, as an ultimately self-destructive solution. On the other hand, they manifest the need to rate the drunkard highly. He is the “only one useful to his country, because he works, while the others only gab.” After praising the drunkard, the participants then identify themselves with him, as workers who also drink—“decent workers.”

相比之下，想象一下一位道德教育家的失败，35 次 布道——反对酗酒，并把一些对这些人而言并非美德表现的东西作为美德的典范。在这种情况下以及其他情况下，唯一合理的程序是对情况进行意识化，这应该从主题调查开始就尝试进行。（显然，意识化并不止于对情况的单纯主观感知，而是通过行动让人们为与阻碍他们人性的障碍作斗争做好准备。）

In contrast, imagine the failure of a moralistic educator,35 sermoniz­-ing against alcoholism and presenting as an example of virtue something which for these men is not a manifestation of virtue. In this and in other cases, the only sound procedure is the conscientização of the situation, which should be attempted from the start of the thematic investigation. (Obviously, conscientização does not stop at the level of mere subjective perception of a situation, but through action ­prepares men for the struggle against the obstacles to their humanization.)

在另一次与农民的交流中，我发现，在讨论田间劳作情景时，不变的主题是要求增加工资，以及必须联合起来成立工会来满足这一特定要求。会议期间讨论了三种情景，主题始终如一。

In another experience, this time with peasants, I observed that the unchanging motif during an entire discussion of a situation de-picting work in the fields was the demand for an increase in wages and the necessity of joining together to create a union to obtain this particular demand. Three situations were discussed during the session, and the motif was always the same.

现在想象一下，一位教育家为这些人组织了他的教育计划，包括阅读“有益的”文本，从中人们了解到“水在井里”。但正是这种事情在教育和政治中一直都在发生，因为人们没有意识到教育的对话性质始于主题调查。

Now imagine an educator who has organized his educational pro-gram for these men, consisting of reading “wholesome” texts in which one learns that “the water is in the well.” But precisely this type of thing happens all the time in both education and politics, because it is not realized that the dialogical nature of education begins with thematic investigation.

一旦圆圈中的解码工作完成，调查的最后阶段就开始了，调查人员将对他们的发现进行系统的跨学科研究。通过收听解码过程中录制的录音带并研究心理学家和社会学家的笔记，调查人员开始列出解码过程中所作肯定的明确或隐含的主题。这些主题应根据不同的社会科学进行分类。分类并不意味着在制定计划时，主题将被视为属于孤立的类别，而只是意味着与主题相关的每个社会科学都以特定的方式看待主题。例如，发展主题特别适合经济学领域，但并非完全如此。社会学、人类学和社会心理学（与文化变迁和态度改变有关的领域）也将关注这一主题它将关注政治学（一个关注发展决策的领域）、教育学等等。这样，表征整体的主题就永远不会被刻板地处理。如果在研究了这些主题与现实其他方面的相互渗透的丰富性之后，随后以牺牲其丰富性（以及其力量）的方式来处理这些主题，以适应专业的限制，那将是一件非常遗憾的事情。

Once the decoding in the circles has been completed, the last stage of the investigation begins, as the investigators undertake a ­systematic interdisciplinary study of their findings. Listening to the tapes recorded during the decoding sessions and studying the notes taken by the psychologists and the sociologist, the investigators be-gin to list the themes explicit or implicit in the affirmations made during the sessions. These themes should be classified according to the various social sciences. Classification does not mean that when the program is elaborated the themes will be seen as belonging to isolated categories, but only that a theme is viewed in a specific ­manner by each of the social sciences to which it is related. The theme of development, for example, is especially appropriate to the field of economics, but not exclusively so. This theme would also be focalized by sociology, anthropology, and social psychology (fields concerned with cultural change and with the modificat ion of attitudes and values—questions which are equally relevant to a philosophy of ­development). It would be focalized by political science (a field ­concerned with the decisions which involve development), by education, and so forth. In this way, the themes which ­characterize a totality will never be approached rigidly. It would indeed be a pity if the themes, after being investigated in the richness of their interpenetration with other aspects of reality, were subsequently to be handled in such a way as to sacrifice their richness (and hence their force) to the strictures of specialties.

完成主题划分后，每位专家都会向跨学科团队提交一个“分解”其主题的项目。在分解主题时，专家会寻找基本核心，这些核心由学习单元组成并建立序列，从而提供主题的总体视图。在讨论每个具体项目时，其他专家会提出建议。这些建议可能会被纳入项目中和/或包含在要撰写的关于该主题的简短论文中，这些论文附有书目建议，是培训将在“文化圈”工作的师生的宝贵辅助工具。

Once the thematic demarcation is completed, each specialist presents to the interdisciplinary team a project for the “breakdown” of his theme. In breaking down the theme, the specialist looks for the fundamental nuclei which, comprising learning units and establishing a sequence, give a general view of the theme. As each specific project is discussed, the other specialists make suggestions. These may be incorporated into the project and/or may be included in the brief essays to be written on the theme, These essays, to which ­bibliographic suggestions are annexed, are valuable aids in training the teacher-students who will work in the “culture circles.”

在分解有意义的主题的过程中，团队将认识到有必要纳入一些基本主题，这些主题在之前的调查中并没有被人们直接提出。这些主题的引入已被证明是必要的，也符合教育的对话性。如果教育节目是对话性的，师生也有权通过纳入之前没有被提出的主题来参与。我把后一种类型的主题称为“铰链主题”，因为它们的功能。它们可以促进节目单元中两个主题之间的联系，填补两者之间可能存在的空白；或者它们可以说明一般节目内容与人们所持的世界观之间的关系。因此，其中一个主题可能位于主题单元的开头。

During this effort to break down the meaningful thematics, the team will recognize the need to include some fundamental themes which were not directly suggested by the people during the preceding investigation. The introduction of these themes has proved to be ­necessary, and also corresponds to the dialogical character of ­education. If educational programming is dialogical, the teacher-­students also have the right to participate by including themes not previously suggested. I call the latter type of theme “hinged themes,” due to their function. They may either facilitate the connection between two themes in the program unit, filling a possible gap between the two; or they may illustrate the relations between the general program content and the view of the world held by the people. Hence, one of these themes may be located at the beginning of thematic units.

人类学的文化概念就是这些铰链之一主题。它阐明了人类在世界上的角色，以及人类作为变革者而非适应者的角色。36

The anthropological concept of culture is one of these hinged themes. It clarifies the role of people in the world and with the world as transforming rather than adaptive beings.36

主题分解完成后，37 接下来就是“编码”阶段：为每个主题及其表现形式选择最佳的沟通渠道。编码可以是简单的，也可以是复杂的。前者利用视觉（图画或图形）、触觉或听觉渠道；后者利用各种渠道。38图画 或图形渠道的选择不仅取决于要编码的材料，还取决于想要交流的人是否识字。

Once the breakdown of the thematics is completed,37 there follows the stage of its “codification”: choosing the best channel of communi­cation for each theme and its representation. A codification may be simple or compound. The former utilizes either the visual (pictorial or graphic), the tactile, or the auditive channel; the latter utilizes various channels.38 The selection of the pictorial or graphic channel depends not only on the material to be codified, but also on whether or not the individuals with whom one wishes to communicate are literate.

主题整理好后，准备教学材料（照片、幻灯片、电影胶片、海报、阅读文本等）。团队可以向外部专家提出一些主题或主题的某些方面作为录音采访的话题。

After the thematics has been codified, the didactic material (photographs, slides, film strips, posters, reading texts, and so forth) is prepared. The team may propose some themes or aspects of some themes to outside specialists as topics for recorded interviews.

让我们以发展主题为例。团队接触两位或多位不同学派的经济学家，向他们介绍节目内容，并邀请他们以听众能理解的语言就该主题进行采访。如果专家接受采访，将录制 15 到 20 分钟的采访。每位专家在讲话时可以拍照。

Let us take the theme of development as an example. The team approaches two or more economists of varying schools of thought, tells them about the program, and invites them to contribute an interview on the subject in language comprehensible to the audi­-ence. If the specialists accept, an interview of fifteen to twenty minutes is taped. A photograph may be taken of each specialist while he is speaking.

当录制好的采访被呈现给文化圈时，会有一个介绍性陈述，说明每位发言者是谁，他或她写过什么，做过什么，以及现在正在做什么；同时，发言者的照片会投射到屏幕上。例如，如果发言者是大学教授，介绍可以包括讨论参与者对大学的看法以及他们对大学的期望。小组已经被告知，录制的采访之后将讨论其内容（作为听觉编码）。随后，团队向专家报告参与者在讨论过程中的反应。这种技术将知识分子与现实联系起来，知识分子往往是善意的，但往往与人民的现实脱节。它也给人民一个机会来倾听和批评知识分子的思想。

When the taped interview is presented to the culture circle, an introductory statement indicates who each speaker is, what she or he has written, done, and doing now; meanwhile, the speaker’s pho­-tograph is projected on a screen. If, for instance, the speaker is a ­university professor, the introduction could include a discussion regarding what the participants think of universities and what they expect of them. The group has already been told that the recorded interview will be followed by a discussion of its contents (which function as an auditive codification). The team subsequently reports to the specialist the reaction of the participants during the discussion. This technique links intellectuals, often well-intentioned but not infrequently alienated from the reality of the people, to that ­reality. It also gives the people an opportunity to hear and criticize the thought of intellectuals.

一些主题或核心可以通过简短的戏剧表演来呈现，只包含主题——没有“解决方案”！戏剧表演充当着一种编纂，作为一种需要讨论的问题提出情况。

Some themes or nuclei may be presented by means of brief dra­matizations, containing the theme only—no “solutions”! The dramatization acts as a codification, as a problem-posing situation to be discussed.

另一种教学资源（只要是在问题提出而非灌输式的教育方法下进行）是阅读和讨论杂志文章、报纸和书籍章节（从段落开始）。与录音采访的情况一样，在小组开始之前先介绍作者，然后再讨论内容。

Another didactic resource—as long as it is carried out within a problem-posing rather than a banking approach to education—is the reading and discussion of magazine articles, newspapers, and book chapters (beginning with passages). As in the case of the recorded interviews, the author is introduced before the group begins, and the contents are discussed afterward.

同样，分析任何事件发生后报纸社论的内容也是必不可少的：“为什么不同的报纸对同一事实有如此不同的解释？”这种做法有助于培养批判意识，这样人们就会对报纸或新闻广播作出反应，而不是作为被动的批评对象。针对他们的“公报”，而是寻求自由的意识。

Along the same lines, it is indispensable to analyze the contents of newspaper editorials following any given event: “Why do ­different newspapers have such different interpretations of the same fact?” This practice helps develop a sense of criticism, so that people will react to newspapers or news broadcasts not as passive objects of the “communiqués” directed at them, but rather as consciousnesses seeking to be free.

准备好所有的教学材料，再加上一些小的入门手册，教育者团队就可以以系统化和详尽的形式向人们重新呈现他们自己的主题。来自人民的主题回归到他们身边——不是作为需要存放的内容，而是作为需要解决的问题。

With all the didactic material prepared, to which should be added small introductory manuals, the team of educators is ready to re­-present to the people their own thematics, in systematized and ­amplified form. The thematics which have come from the people return to them—not as contents to be deposited, but as problems to be solved.

基础教育教师的首要任务是介绍教育运动的总体方案。人们会发现自己身处这个方案之中；它对他们来说并不奇怪，因为它是他们发起的。教育工作者还将（基于教育的对话性质）解释方案中枢纽主题的存在及其意义。

The first task of the basic-education teachers is to present the general program of the educational campaign. The people will find themselves in this program; it will not seem strange to them, since it originated with them. The educators will also explain (based on the dialogical character of education) the presence in the program of the hinged themes, and their significance.

如果教育工作者没有足够的资金来进行上述的初步主题调查，他们可以在了解最低限度的情况的情况下，选择一些基本主题作为“待调查的汇编”。 相应地，他们可以从入门主题开始，同时启动进一步的主题调查。

If the educators lack sufficient funds to carry out the preliminary thematic investigation as described above, they can—with a minimum knowledge of the situation—select some basic themes to serve as “codifications to be investigated.” Accordingly, they can begin with introductory themes and simultaneously initiate further thematic investigation.

这些基本主题之一（我认为是核心且不可或缺的主题）是人类学的文化概念。无论男女是农民还是城市工人，无论是学习阅读还是参加扫盲后课程，他们寻求更多知识（就该术语的工具意义而言）的起点都是对这一概念的辩论。当他们讨论文化世界时，他们表达了对现实的认识水平，其中隐含着各种主题。他们的讨论涉及现实的其他方面，这些方面逐渐被人们以一种越来越批判的方式看待。这些方面又涉及许多其他主题。

One of these basic themes (and one which I consider central and indispensable) is the anthropological concept of culture. Whether men and women are peasants or urban workers, learning to read or enrolled in a post-literacy program, the starting point of their search to know more (in the instrumental meaning of the term) is the debate of the concept. As they discuss the world of culture, they express their level of awareness of reality, in which various themes are implicit. Their discussion touches upon other aspects of ­reality, which comes to be perceived in an increasingly critical manner. These aspects in turn involve many other themes.

凭借现在的经验，我可以肯定，文化的概念，如果能从所有或大部分方面进行富有想象力的讨论，可以为教育计划提供各种方面。此外，在与文化圈参与者进行几天的对话后，教育者可以直接询问参与者：“还有什么其他主题或者除了这些我们还可以讨论什么主题？”每个人回答后，答案就会被记录下来，并立即作为问题向小组提出。

With the experience now behind me, I can affirm that the concept of culture, discussed imaginatively in all or most of its dimensions, can provide various aspects of an educational program. In addition, after several days of dialogue with the culture circle participants, the educators can ask the participants directly: “What other themes or subjects could we discuss besides these?” As each person replies, the answer is noted down and is immediately proposed to the group as a problem.

例如，小组成员之一可能会说：“我想谈谈民族主义。”“很好，”教育者说，记下了建议，并补充说：“民族主义是什么意思？为什么讨论民族主义对我们有任何兴趣？”我的经验表明，当一个建议作为问题向小组提出时，就会出现新的主题。如果在一个（例如）三十个文化圈在同一天晚上开会的地区，所有的“协调员”（教育者）都以这种方式进行，那么中心团队将拥有丰富的主题材料可供研究。

One of the group members may say, for example: “I’d like to talk abut nationalism.” “Very well,” says the educator, noting down the suggestion, and adds: “What does nationalism mean? Why is a discussion about nationalism of any interest to us?” My experience shows that when a suggestion is posed as a problem to the group, new themes appear. If, in an area where (for example) thirty culture circles meet on the same night, all the “co-ordinators” (educators) proceed in this fashion, the central team will have a rich variety of thematic material for study.

从自由主义教育的角度来看，重要的是让人们通过讨论他们自己和同志的建议中明确或隐含地体现的思想和世界观，逐渐感受到自己是思想的主人。因为这种教育观始于这样的信念：它不能提出自己的计划，而必须与人民对话地寻找这个计划，它有助于引入被压迫者的教育学，被压迫者必须参与其中。

The important thing, from the point of view of libertarian edu­cation, is for the people to come to feel like masters of their ­thinking by discussing the thinking and views of the world explicitly or im-plicitly manifest in their own suggestions and those of their comrades. Because this view of education starts with the conviction that it cannot present its own program but must search for this program dialogically with the people, it serves to introduce the pedagogy of the oppressed, in the elaboration of which the oppressed must participate.

笔记

Notes

1

1

2其中一些想法是在与 Ernani Maria Fiori 教授交谈后产生的。

2 Some of these reflections emerged as a result of conversations with Professor Ernani Maria Fiori.

3我显然不是指深思时的静默，在这种静默中，人们只是表面上离开了世界，从中抽身而出，以便全面考虑世界，从而与世界同在。但这种隐退只有当冥想者“沐浴”在现实中时才是真实的；而不是当隐退意味着对世界的蔑视和逃避，就像一种“历史性精神分裂症”一样。

3 I obviously do not refer to the silence of profound meditation, in which men only apparently leave the world, withdrawing from it in order to consider it in its ­totality, and thus remaining with it. But this type of retreat is only authentic when the meditator is “bathed” in reality; not when the retreat signifies contempt for the world and flight from it, in a type of “historical schizophrenia.”

4我越来越相信，真正的革命者必须将革命视为一种爱的行为，因为它具有创造性和解放性。对我来说，革命与爱并非不可调和，革命离不开革命理论——因此也离不开科学。相反，革命是人们为了实现人性化而进行的。事实上，除了使人失去人性，促使人们成为革命者的更深层次动机是什么？资本主义世界对“爱”一词的扭曲并不能阻止革命本质上具有爱的性质，也不能阻止革命者肯定他们对生活的热爱。格瓦拉（虽然承认“显得荒谬”的风险）并不害怕肯定这一点：“让我冒着显得荒谬的风险说，真正的革命者是由强烈的爱的情感引导的。没有这种品质，就不可能想象出真正的革命者。” 《我们必胜——切·格瓦拉的演讲和著作》，约翰·杰拉西编辑（纽约，1969 年），第 398 页。

4 I am more and more convinced that true revolutionaries must perceive the ­revolution, because of its creative and liberating nature, as an act of love. For me, the ­revolution, which is not possible without a theory of revolution—and therefore ­science—is not irreconcilable with love. On the contrary: the revolution is made by ­people to achieve their humanization. What, indeed, is the deeper motive which moves individuals to become revolutionaries, but the dehumanization of people? The distortion imposed on the word “love” by the capitalist world cannot prevent the revolution from being essentially loving in character, nor can it prevent the ­revolutionaries from affirming their love of life. Guevara (while admitting the “risk of seeming ridiculous”) was not afraid to affirm it: “Let me say, with the risk of ­appearing ridiculous, that the true revolutionary is guided by strong feelings of love. It is impossible to think of an authentic revolutionary without this quality.” ­Venceremos—The Speeches and Writings of Che Guevara, edited by John Gerassi (New York, 1969), p. 398.

5来自一位朋友的信。

5 From the letter of a friend.

6 Pierre Furter，Educação e Vida（里约热内卢，1966 年），第 26-27 页。

6 Pierre Furter, Educação e Vida (Rio, 1966), pp. 26–27.

7在与马尔罗的一次长谈中，毛泽东宣称：“你知道，我早就说过：我们必须把从群众那里得到的含糊不清的东西清楚地教给他们。”安德烈·马尔罗，《反回忆录》（纽约，1968 年），第 361-362 页。这一断言包含了关于如何构建教育计划内容的完整对话理论，而教育计划内容不能根据教育者认为最适合学生的内容来制定。

7 In a long conversation with Malraux, Mao-Tse-Tung declared, “You know I’ve proclaimed for a long time: we must teach the masses clearly what we have received from them confusedly.” André Malraux, Anti-Memoirs (New York, 1968), pp. 361–362. This affirmation contains an entire dialogical theory of how to construct the ­program content of education, which cannot be elaborated according to what the ­educator thinks best for the students.

8 Furter，上文引文，第 165 页。

8 Furter, op. cit., p. 165.

9后者通常沉浸在殖民背景中，与自然世界几乎有着密切的联系，他们觉得自己是自然世界的组成部分，而不是塑造者。

9 The latter, usually submerged in a colonial context, are almost ­umbilically linked to the world of nature, in relation to which they feel themselves to be ­component parts rather than shapers.
